course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Introduction to Information Systems
course.description: Information systems (IS) is about managing the applications of IT to create business values. Topics include fundamental concepts of IS, e-commerce, digital and internet economy, web 2.0 and social networks, online advertising, personalization and privacy, digital rights management and piracy, business intelligence and decision-making, how organizations harness IS for innovative business strategies, and the socio-economic impact of IS on organizations and societies. The labs cover business problem-solving skills.

reviews.author: Fairyfire
reviews.title: A Totally Useless Course
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture:
Digital economy
E-commerce
Online platforms
Big data analytics
Fintech
One project
Lab:
some VBA and SQL things, but only concept things, you don't need to go deeply into the syntax.
Basically, the lab is ok and is kind of useful. But the lecture is just a pile of trash. The professor will teach you some very superficial conceptions about so-called digital network and frontier technology such as Bitcoin, but they are useless since that knowledge is either common sense or really superficial.
The organization and criteria regarding the project are chaotic and changeable. It seems like the professor herself even don't know what we should hand in.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has an obvious accent but this is actually bearable. The point is that her teaching skills are TOO BAD!!! She doesn't know how to explain an idea clearly and her PPT is a mess. There is no logic in her PPT. I believe anyone else can help reorganize her PPT and definitely do better than her.
reviews.comment_grading:
Really bad.
I don't actually know the cut-off.
Class participation 15%                                        
Labs 15%
Group project 20%
Midterm 20%
Final 30%
Also, we knew nothing about the grades of the project. It is non-transparent.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. You can skip the lessons and I think her teaching is of no use. But remember to come to every lab because it takes attendance. I think sometimes you just need to create your own insights of those concepts. And don't be frustrated if you only get a very low grade since it shows nothing about your capability. I cannot see the meaning of this course.

reviews.author: K.
reviews.comment_content: lectures+labs
reviews.comment_teaching: TK is good at teaching. He is quite hardworking I would say. I have never missed a single lecture in  the whole semester and I was quite enjoying taking isom class during this semester. But I became so disappointed after the project grading was released. The final exam and the grading just made things worse.
reviews.comment_grading: I cannot say this grading is fare enough. We had 8 meetings before the presentation and  the whole process started a month before the presentation. We got a high grade BUT EVERYBODY DID!!! mean=9.2 high 9.75 which means the project didn't affect much about your final grading. At the beginning of the semester, TK told us that a student who got midterm and final below mean but did a great job in the project and got A-. But I got half a sd above mean in midterm and 2 score below mean in final and got B  My project is 9.5/10. I believed in TK and I liked him so I spent much more time on the project but the result turned out to be like this.
reviews.comment_workload: The project is very tiring. The final and midterm......I memorized everything but I forgot to prepare for the SQL and We were asked to write SQL by ourselves where I guess I lost all 15 scores. If the grading of the project is similar, I strongly suggest that you spend less time on your

Lecture:

Lab:

The console TK used to let us give comment is a complete disaster. First, he gave us a deadline. Second, the website is always overload. Third, TK just delays the deadline when the console down. Forth, The console seldom works before that deadline. Fifth, WE HAVE TO F5 EVERY SECOND TO KNOW WHEN IT WORKS.
????????????????????????????????????????
You can never imagine how many hours we spent on this matter LOL
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighting:
- 15% lab
included the final exam (lab part): 10% and lab attendance: 5%
- 25% Final (lecture part)
- 20% MT
The format of MT and final is similar
- 20% Project
Every group got a similar score in presentation, about 9/10
- 20% Class contribution
No one knows what is it, maybe is the quality of the comment you gave to the presenter? or the comment others gave you? who knows?
/
Data:
- MT mean: 28.2/34; s.d.: 3
- Final(lab) mean: 38.7/50; s.d.: 6.9
- Final(lecture) mean: 38/49; s.d.: 6.8
/
Myself:
MT: about mean
Final(lab): >1sd
Final(lecture): >1sd
lab attendance: missed 1
project presentation: 9/10
=> B+
/
The grading process is not very clear which raise a great controversy
At least, I don't think the grade is very good
reviews.comment_workload:
Lecture:
- 2 reading assignment, just read and write some respond
- Group project: A business idea with implementing the concept you learnt in class

* Everyone works crazy hard on the project, you have to present it to the whole class
* Everyone in that section need give comment to the group just presented, and every group have to give a final report after receiving all these comments and improving the idea

Lab:
- small quiz after every lab, just copy other

reviews.author: Soberzz
reviews.title: 垃圾
reviews.comment_content:
E commerce, database
學完差唔多好似無學咁
reviews.comment_teaching: 算係肯答學生問題 但係經常性強調某D野唔會答 過左咩時間又唔會答 俾midterm practicepaper 你做但又無答案 好辛苦
reviews.comment_grading:
極差 Mean = C+ 爛grade professor。
我reading assignment做齊 feedback填曬每段100字倒 lab quiz做齊 midterm低mean 1分final同mean 差唔多(final容易到嗰個都9成咁滯)
Group project presentation 高mean少少 report低mean 少少 拉埋同mean一樣(group project基本上你有做嘢全部人都有9分以上)
Final Grade : C (我真係唔明)
想要靚grade reg其他professor 千奇唔好reg佢
reviews.comment_workload: 極大,  4份reading assignments, 尤其group presentation個period, 除左要prepare自己group ppt同 report, 同一時間你仲要去console俾feedback其他group presentation. 每一個feedback 無返咁上下長度又會無quantity, 寫得唔好又會無quality 基本200字, 每一次三個feedback, 限你當日之內做完，total 大概9個feedback

reviews.author: holam
reviews.title: ISOM 2010 Tat Koon
reviews.comment_content: Basic ISOM concept learning extremely fundamentally and abstractly
reviews.comment_teaching:
He talks about how to apply the concept quite well. However, any discussion you found in the lecture will not be tested in exam. So generally the lecture is a good way for you to polish shoes(擦鞋). Your aim is making Tat Koon remembers your name, so that you will get a good score in the project presentation.
One good thing is that there is lecture recording.

But overall, I slept every meaningless lesson, which is not helpful for final exam
reviews.comment_grading:
Industry week and reading assignments (5%)(everyone get full mark)
Group project evaluation (10%) not released
Group project presentation (10%)  12/15 Mean 12.4 Min 10.5 Max 13.3
Group project report(10%) 13/15 Mean 12.9 Min 11 Max 13.5
Midterm (20%) 20/23 Mean 16.3 Max 23
Final (30%) 55/56 Mean 45.2 Max 56 Min 7 SD 9.6
Lab Quiz(5%) Everyone got full
Lab Exam (10%) 49/50 Mean 40 Max 50 (thanks chan hiu ting)

This course still have business school characteristics: it tests how careful you are

Hint 1: Lab Exam is very similar to the Lab Quiz, and make sure you know who is making the paper(this sem is Chan Hiu Ying, do not waste time to ask or learn from other irrelevant TA)
Hint 2: The final exam this sem consists of 13 marks MC, 14 marks of SQ(pricing of platform, what is primary key) and 29 marks of SQL
Hint 3: Tat koon True False question is rubbish. In midterm, the answer of all six question is false

Final Letter Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much.
You need to waste time to listen to others' project and give them comments(of course lengthy is the basic)
One project presentation and one project report(with quite small SD, dont pay too much effort, but ensure the peer evaluation from your groupmate should be good because it affects your grading quite much, thus the basic is polish the shoe of tat koon).
Only two reading assignments, which you do not need to read the passage and just randomly write some rubbish words can ensure you get the full marks.

reviews.author: Kabe
reviews.title: Not that great
reviews.comment_content: More like Introduction to consulting (McKinsey) or Introduction to strategic management. This course includes basic IS concepts without technical details (except for SQL). And TK always mentions how business executives should have a digital mindset to improve the company blahblahblah... So this course is more like teaching us to be a business executive. Many things are included but nothing deep, as this is an introductory course.
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't pay much attention because I think the course is boring, but TK did try to include some everyday life example in the course. Originally I think he is quite bad but I am really glad that he listened to my opinion in midterm feedback to include some technical things in the course (SQL). Btw his own course console is horrible, the server is like having a maximum capacity of 30, and it was broken throughout the whole presentation period.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation 20%
Labs 15%
Group Project 20%
Midterm Exam 20%
Final Exam 25%
For class participation, it depends on your reviews' rating in the group project and also two reading assignment (super easy one).
Labs is 5% weekly lab + 10% final exam.
I got 47/50 in final. Mean ~38, SD 6.x
Group project undisclosed.
Midterm: 32.33/34, Mean=28, SD=3
Final: 45.5/49, Mean ~38, SD 6.x
I got A, perhaps the group project is not as good, but fair enough.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy actually. My groupmates freeride me and I have to do the project by myself. Plus there are midterms and finals, so this course is really demanding, despite the fact that it doesn't have much meaningful content.

reviews.author: jm9
reviews.title: 小心啲,巨伏 try your best to swap if you can [lecture]
reviews.comment_content:
<Lecture Topics>
Digital Economy1234

online platform_google 12
business analytic12
fintech (not examed)

final: not released
group project: not released (I sent 2 emails to ask for the detail and no one gave me a shit)
letter grade: C+

What's happening?
reviews.comment_workload: the only workload was the group project (lecture)

reviews.author: jnjaem0825
reviews.title: NONSENSE GRADING!!
reviews.comment_content: Just as you can see in other reviews, this course is basically about introduction to information system, all kinds of memorizing stuffs, quite boring and useless.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, Tat Koon teaches good, he uses some interesting examples to explain the concept, but still the biggest problem is that the content of this course is very boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Hell grading!!! Don't trust him if he says that work hard will be easy to get good grade.

Grading scheme is mainly composed of 1 midterm, 1 final, 3 reading assignments, project, presentation, lab quiz, lab final, peer evaluation, participation, attendance(only industrial week and presentation weeks). Details of percentage in every part plz look at other review because I am too lazy to look at syllabus.

Both questions in lecture midterm and final are too easy, only 15 questions at most, it's very hard to distinguish students ability and learning outcome. Differences in good grade and bad grade are just whether you study or if you are careless. Very easy to get above mean.

For project and presentation, he gives almost everyone same score in two sections, doesn't distinguish students apart in your project score even if you work very hard, still get same score as those who work only median.

For 3 reading assignments, I guess everyone can get full score, unless you forget to submit.

As for the lab part, don't miss weekly quiz and you can get full score. Lab final is quite median, even though I don't have any VBA background and skip almost half of the lab classes, just study before final, watch lab recordings, and you can get mean in final.

For me, I got above mean 1...sd almost full score in both lecture midterm and final, almost full score in project presentation and report, full score in reading assignments, full score in lab quiz, mean in lab final, little above mean in participation part.

Nothing below mean but ended up in C+. WTF, so nonsense I could only comment this, if you want to choose IS major in MSE, please swap to other prof's section because the possibility of getting bad grade in his class is very high. 爛龜爛龜爛龜！
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload mainly comes from doing project and presentation, especially if you get freerider in your group, then good luck to you.

Another workload may be writing feedback on other group's presentation, you need to submit 3 reviews on other's presentation before midnight of the lecture day except the day when your group has presentation. And Tat Koon will grade your review as a part of participation. He said nobody gets full score in this part but No one knows his standards???

Just revise your ppt before midterm and final, actually exams aren't heavy workload in this course.

3 reading assignments are all asking about to what extent do you agree with the idea, or do you agree with the concept, only some ticks or choose 1~10, you can finish in less than 5 minutes without reading the article.

reviews.author: Mitchell Wu
reviews.comment_content:
Covers a broad range of topics relating to Big Data, AI/ML, Business Analytics, Network effect, e-commerce. Professor stresses that this course is more of a 'roadmap' to give you a better idea of what direction you might want to go in terms of career/course choices.

Not sure if this will carry over to other semesters but, we also went fairly deep into Blockchain technology as we had to research it's applications (not how to make one) for the group project.
reviews.comment_teaching: Slides are very clear, encourages simple but effective class participation (i.e. brainstorming) to stimulate interest. The slides themselves are more than sufficient to study and take the exam with (as the exams were open book). Frankly speaking, Prof Yin is one of the friendliest, most helpful, and articulate teachers I've had in my UST career so far.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 25%
Final 25%
Lab Exam (30 mins) 15%
Lab Participation 15% (in-class quizzes, unlimited tries)
Group project 20%
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively low, you can essentially relax through this course given that you pay attention in class and engage with the content. He makes an effort to make sure everybody is prepared for the exam(s). If anything, the workload is based on your peers, since the average score for this course is usually higher (but not extreme). If you want to get into IS, try to go for +1SD (A-).

For the group project we had to prepare a 15 min presentation talking about blockchain and proposing a solution to help with a certain business process. Interesting stuff, just make sure you stay organized and spread the workload. Pretty much every group used scripts, but he encouraged us afterwards that we should also try taking a more casual tone (less scripted) as it will benefit us more in the future.

reviews.author: vixxf6
reviews.title: Not good
reviews.comment_content: Someone has mentioned it already. Just scroll the page.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think his teaching is okay. But personally, I don't like his teaching style because he likes to explain every small point in details and with examples. However, I am not that type of people who like to receive this kind of teaching style. But if you are the one who like someone to explain to you everything in details. He might be the right choice.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't actually get how his grading system worked. Since I did pretty well in the midterm and I get a little bit below mean in final, I prefer that I would get like around B- or something as my lowest grade. However, he even gave me a lower grade!! Unbelievable! Many people in my class questioned about his grading system too. So, fellows who choose to be his students in the following years, be careful!
reviews.comment_workload: I think the workload is fair and just similar to other courses. But no weekly or monthly homework is included so it might be a good news. However, the group project is quite tedious because you need to think of some new IT ideas and give presentations  to the whole class. Be aware of it.

reviews.author: hypetrain
reviews.title: Don't take this course from her
reviews.comment_content: Lots of stuff. Nothing too deep. See the other reviews for content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Terrible professor that can't speak English and has issues with getting her message across. I genuinely couldn't understand whole sentences sometimes. Lessons were boring and I often left the Zoom class mid-way as I was falling asleep. As it was an online semester, I planned to re-watch lecture videos in 1.5 speed but couldn't due to her accent. The TAs are even worse, especially Samuel Lai, who comes off as arrogant and is unresponsive when it comes to emails about midterms or exam scores. He also intentionally emphasizes his Hong Kong accent in his lab videos. Weird & terrible teaching. TA Olivia is nice and knows how to teach. So you may want to go to her if you have any issues. There also seems to be a lack of understanding and communication between the prof and the TAs. The professor told us to Canvas message her the report, few days later the TAs asked us to fill in a form on another site. There is also a clash between the prof and TAs about giving out the project scores.
reviews.comment_grading: Terrible grading. Probably got around 80% (project score is not disclosed) overall and got C-range. When I asked the professor about my project grade she asked me to ask Samuel and then he said he wouldn't be willing to tell me lol pos.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a group project (20% and 10% peer evaluation) that is unreasonably annoying where we had to hand in a report and a ppt. There are also industry talks (5% attendance), lab quizzes (5%), a midterm (20%), a lecture final (30%)and a lab final (10%). Good luck.

reviews.author: Saik
reviews.title: useless course
reviews.comment_content:
教ge野係介乎常識與無咁多人知ge常識之間，典型ge吹水course。學完都唔知學左d乜，唔知點解可以將d咩network effect，porters five forces咁ge term pack埋一齊就當一個course。老實講，呢d野可能有用ge，但係屬於果種需要用ge話可以開youtube幾分鐘學就學完ge，唔值得開一個course黎教。簡單d講，摺左佢啦。

Lab session稍微好少少，會教下excel，VBA，SQL etc.，起碼叫做有d technical。不過缺點係每樣教少少，少要好似教programming淨係教咩係data type咁，far from being practical
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Chen個人幾nice ge，你問問題佢會好有耐心答，可以睇得出佢有嘗試教得好。但係佢ge英文一般，有時候講一個字就pause一秒咁。（覺得佢ge英文係最尾果堂Q&A突然有明顯進步，唔知係咪我ge錯覺）d lectures係understandable，不過聽得有d辛苦。
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab 5% quiz+10%final
Midterm 20%
Final 30%
Parti 15%
AD project 20%

Lab 5% quiz係unlimited attempt人人都full。parti有5%係industry talk attendance10%係project peer evaulation。project唔出分。

我個人：
midterm below mean (mean16.X/20)
final full (mean 25.X/30)
lab final 9.X/10 (mean 6.86/10)
寫review果陣未出letter grade

要上堂，我一開始覺得lecture無用，結果mt below mean。雖然因為個course廢，上堂真係學唔到野，但係好多野係佢slides無寫，上堂果陣會講而考試又再出返。所以為左gpa，都係要上堂(如果online上我建議走堂睇replay)。

Edit:
final grade：A
算係幾好啦，mt炒左之後無太大expectation，final起死回生完全係意外之喜。
reviews.comment_workload: 主要係份AD project。搵好teammates分好工基本上都無太大問題，不過我無business頭腦同唔識吹水，做果陣覺得好麻煩同痛苦。Prof Chen教ge話唔需要present。

reviews.author: IanChan
reviews.comment_content: Fine content, teaching about basic python knowledge. taught about basic system about the internet, business internal system stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes the accent may cause difficulty to understanding. It took me a whole semester to understand the word he said: "DATA", which he pronounced "dada" every single time.
reviews.comment_grading: mid-term above mean around 1 sd, exam equal mean. but still, get me a B-. Still trying my best to figure out why.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair enough. Not much stress at the daily workload. one presentation is required at the end of this courese.

reviews.author: Ged
reviews.title: Useful stuffs, acceptable teaching but wth of the grades?
reviews.comment_content:
1. Basic concept of how to develop modern software for companies using computer CS technologies (just an intro of basic ideas and concept, no actual programming)
2. Common methods that modern companies using to solve some internal and external problems like crowdsourcing
3. Intro of companies like platforms using new technologies like the Internet
4. Labs: VBA, Microsoft access (data base), SQL, Azure(will not be tested in exam)
I would say these stuffs are not that useless, at least they can help you know more about how modern companies operate.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TKK has accent, I mean it is apparent, but how it will affect your understanding depends because as for me I am fine with it. However, if you are sentitive to strange accent, it may be an obstacle.
Overall, TKK is good. He pays effort trying to make his teaching good. He would use some vivid examples and diagrams to illustrate the stuffs that he wanna address.
reviews.comment_grading:
VERY EXTREMELY COMPETITIVE
91=A
89=B+
?
BESIDES,
pls pay more attention to participation (15%), because the marks I lost in PARTICIPATION is MORE than MID AND FINAL EXAM!!!! It is not just simply attending the lectures and signing in. It involves some something like peer evaluation.
But after all, B range is extremely large. So don't be too worried about getting a bad grade.
Overall score: 86-87%
Final letter: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate.
Only 2-3 HW which would cost 10-20 mins each.
Group work is relatively hard because a script and report and a pre are needed.
Do more review before mid and final exam. That could be tough.

reviews.author: JNC
reviews.title: Merely useful content, and nonsense assessment
reviews.comment_content: Brief intro to different IS concepts and trends. Not many technical parts. Extremely easy. I don't know why this course is 3credits while 2020 and 2600 1 credit only.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite funny. Used a lot of examples in the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
on9.
Extremely short and easy assessments. (midterm only 7 MC/TF, final only 50minutes)

Project marks everyone get 90%+.

Checked with my friends, what really differentiate your grades is the feedbacks you gave to other groups' presentations.

Overall grading 1 mark 1 grade, 89% is B+, 91% is A.

To conclude, easy to get a decent grade, VERY DIFFICULT to get A range (depends on luck a lot)
reviews.comment_workload: Tooooooo light for a 3 credit course.

reviews.author: Mky
reviews.comment_content: Digital Economy(1-3) --> E-Commerce(1-4) --> Midterm Exam --> Digital Platform(1-3) --> Big Data(1-4) --> Group Project Presentation --> Final Exam
reviews.comment_teaching: He speaks clearly and asks a lot of question during the class. He also gives many examples for you to understands the concept and those examples might be useful for your final exam. For answering email, Fast! You mostly will receive his email within that day(suppose you ask at noon but not at midnight).
reviews.comment_grading:
His grading is fair.
Participation 15%
Lab 15%
Group project 20%
Midterm exam 25%
Final exam 25%
Total 100%

Especially careful for the class participation part!!!
(You have to type in the chatbox for answering his question in order to get the participation mark)

Lab:
We have unlimited attempt to do the lab quiz questions, so you can try the answers until you got all correct. For the lab exam, open the Excel to do is faster than you think ;)

Group project:
In my semester, the project topic is "blockchain". It is quite difficult as most of us are not familiar with and what taught in the lesson for this topic is only a few pages. But at last, the mean for the project is quite high (ard17~18/20)

Midterm & Final:
Midterm exam consists of MCs and short q. Those short q is basically simple math. Final exam are short q only. And those short q is really typing and very little calculation.

Conclusion:
If you really listen to the class and take revision, it is not difficult to get a good grade from this course and this professor as those concepts are not difficult to understand. (from 學渣)
reviews.comment_workload: I think it is fair for a 3-credit course. Compared to other 3-credit courses, the workload is lighter.

reviews.author: a cute boy
reviews.comment_content: the content of this course is a bit boring but sometimes useful. the exam content is not so meaningful in my mind because it just requires us to fully recite every word in the PPT. the lab goes too fast
reviews.comment_teaching: tkk is not as humorous as expected and his class is not so interesting as expected, but also not too bad. his spoken English is good enough to understand and his feedback of our project is adequate. one of the things that I don't like is that he gives more chance and more attention to reactive students in the class, and also better grade, but I think that different students have different learning approaches. the most interactive ones are not always the best.
reviews.comment_grading: different students have different comments. all of my exam result and group project grading are above mean, average about 0.5 sd, but I got b.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is ok. not too heavy.

reviews.author: checkitonce
reviews.title: Well...not as good grade as people said
reviews.comment_content: Nothing special...Just something common sense and like everyone will know those things. He taught something like marketing in IS, I don't think the course is really totally about IS. I think the lab sections are more useful indeed, they taught us how to make a website and use google analytics, basic Microsoft Excel vba and Microsoft Azure machine(??), something more practical I would say.
reviews.comment_teaching: His lessons are quite boring I would say, I didn't attend most of the lectures and I did see his lecture videos, just put it like 1.5x and u feel more comfortable to hear his voice. His lecture notes are not that useful and blanks are needed to be filled in, just ask your friends about that. Just watch his lecture videos if u feel you don't want to listen
reviews.comment_grading:
Well not as good grade as the others have said, people called him grade god but I don't think so
Lab: attended all lab sections and slightly above mean in lab exam
No group project final report marks, 9/10 in group presentation.
Midterm below 1.3SD and final below 0.3 SD
Reading assessment full marks well everyone got full marks
Attended the industry talks....
At last C+ fair geh
Well I didn't expect much from him...
reviews.comment_workload: Group projects are really chur.... We spent endless nights in dealing with the prototype and the presentation and the final reports....and at last we don't know our marks...damn! assignments are super easy gehhh

reviews.author: RyanSo628
reviews.title: Tat Koon is a must choice!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
A brief Introduction of information systems.
The content is very general and nothing technical.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tat Koon is a good and passionate instructor that makes you to be in love with IS.
His teaching is interesting (sometimes it is boring because the content is boring) and he gives out good grading.
reviews.comment_grading:
As there are many people studying in this course, competition is unavoidable.
If you want a good grade in this course, try following:
1. try not to screw up in midterm and final (at least get score above mean)
2. try to come up an innovative ideas with using advanced technology in your project application development.
3. try to consult tak koon for the project idea and be active in class (asking questions and response to his questions(some questions are very easy!!!))
reviews.comment_workload:
There is project, midterm, finals and lab. Try not to miss any classes and participate actively in class and let professor know your existence. Project workload is high as you need to try build a prototype for your business app.
For final and midterm, please try to recite all the lecture notes as much as possible.

reviews.author: PPBBB
reviews.title: A Funny Professor
reviews.comment_content: The lecture part is separated from the lab part. There are only 18 lectures and 10 labs in total. An industry week and presentation weeks took 6 lectures away.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a new professor at HKUST but he is an experienced professor elsewhere. His teaching is interesting as he made jokes during classes. Remember don't miss any of his classes, as you may not be able to catch up if you miss it. No video will be uploaded to Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very good as long as you pay efforts on the course.
Exams are non-cumulative and all are MCQs.
Class participation [10%]
Lab [15%]
Project [20%]
Midterm Exam [25%]
Final Exam [30%]
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not that heavy. You can form your own groups and starts the project asap. The major workload is, indeed, the project. As you have to prepare the proposal, powerpoint presentation as well as the written report for the project.
LAB section does not require you to submit a work to the TAs, but you have to do a quiz instead, to check your understanding of the topics.

reviews.author: cwr
reviews.title: Not bad grades, but terrible learning experience.
reviews.comment_content:
The final exam is non-cumulative.
There is a separate exam for lecture and lab.

Topics covered in midterm:
1. Digital economy fundamentals
(what is IT? what is Information? information overload etc.)
2. IT and businss strategies
(porters 5 forces, network effects, strategic positioning etc.)
3. E-commerce
(Google and ChatGPT)

Topics covered in finals:
1. Business analytics
(Database, SQL, similar to lab)
2. Fintech
(Cryptocurrency, NFTs etc.)

Project:
Do a 35 page ppt and a 5 page report.
Also pay 4 USD to access the case questions (you can download/search online for a free version)

Participation:
If you are honest, ask a question in class and record it in Canvas.
You can also lie and make shit up.

Lab:
1. Excel functions:
(AND, IF, VLOOKUP etc.)
2. Excel VBA:
(Some crazy confusing code; you don't need to know how to code, but the MCQs will require you to understand what the block of code does, and you have to figure out the output)
3. Access and SQL
(basically SELECT SELECT SELECT)

Industry week:
Listen to talksand you are done.
If you can't attend, you have to watch a video and "write" a report.
Counts towards participation, so just do it.

Basically haven't learnt anything, but I will forever remember Network Effects.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Horrible.
But you will be fine studying on your own.
Just go to lectures to ask/answer questions and earn participation credit.

The lab TAs suck.
I'm sorry. But you are fucking terrible.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm has a crazy high mean: 44/48; probably similar for finals.
Got me worried that I got 40; went to papercheck and then they raised my score to 48.
(Two MC questions were cancelled)
Finals and project scores have yet to be released.
The finals for lab is 40 points, but it only counts 10% of the entire ISOM2010 grade. Which means it is not very significant.
Make sure you do your project well, and at least ask some questions in class to get participation credit.
I only did about 75% of all the possible participation counts, but still I got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The group project would take a significant amount of time.
The project also only starts towards the end of the course, and project deadline clashes with some final exams.
Otherwise, relatively light workload.
Studying for the exams is basically just going through the slides and writing notes if that's something you do.

reviews.author: dos0_282
reviews.title: RUN!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture
Digital Economy
E-Commerce
- Google
- ChatGPT
Business Analytics (Access)
Fintech

Labs (10)
VBA, Access, Microsoft Azure

Tons of bullshit. I rather self-studied.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of the lectures was horrible. She didn’t even know what she’s saying. Accent was strong but understandable.
The teaching of the labs wasn’t much better. The TA just read out the handouts and won’t stop and check your progress. Literally useless except the computers give you the application you need to finish your tasks.
The worst thing was the attendance system. It tells you to ask or answer questions every lecture to get participation marks. Guess what? Half of the lecture time will become Q&A session, where students try to raise useless questions.

Another thing was that many students would cheat to get their participation. There was no TA to record the participation marks during the lecture. What you have to do is to type your questions in the discussion section in Canvas. Many students would paraphrase others answer to cheat for the marks. They knew the fucking problem but they just don’t fix it!
reviews.comment_grading:
I haven’t get my grade yet but I am going to give this a E anyways.
15% Participation
15% Labs
20% Mid term
20% Group project
30% Final
reviews.comment_workload:
Participation can be earned by cheating so I guess this part isn’t a problem. But there were some compulsory talks to join during the industry week, or your would have to write a report after watching the recordings.
The labs were “compulsory” but in fact you could just get full marks by doing the quizzes and guessing the MCs. No big deal.
The biggest problem was the group project. Its format was like a case competition. My groupmates and I spent around 20 hours to finish the whole comprehensive assignment.

reviews.author: FoodieHaha
reviews.comment_content: Content are easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Yin's classes are very interactive. He will walk around the whole lecture hall to ask you questions. (It makes you stay awake)
His teaching slides are simple, clear and easy to understanding so it is easy for you to catch up.
I attended another professor's lectures as well, and found out that professor Yin's lectures are much more better (much more interesting)
Strongly recommended!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. As more and more students want to choose IS as their major, the means were relatively high.
Grading breakdown:
Total Score (100%)
87.8/100, mean 76/100, sd 11.7
Discussion Contribution (15%)
15/15, mean 11.2/15, sd 3.8
This is based on in-class and canvas discussion
Lab (15%)
10.7/15, mean 10.1/15, sd 2.6
Group project (20%)
19/20, mean 17.5/20, sd 1.5
Midterm Exam
21.3/25, mean 19.2/25, sd 3.4
Lecture final exam
21.8/25, mean 17.9/25, sd 3.9
Final Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload in terms of regular assignments, you just need to participate in the weekly class discussion.
However, the workload for the project is high. Professor announced the details and requirements of the project lately (only 3-4 weeks before the submission deadline) and there were a quite a lot of questions you need to answer in order to complete the project.
Tips: finding good teammates are important!

reviews.author: busi trash
reviews.title: 必reg又chill又靚grade嘅prof.
reviews.comment_content:
Digital economy
E-commerce
Digital platform
Big data
教好多terms，都係日常生活it野，唔算難。
reviews.comment_teaching: 無聽書唔太肯定教成點，英文係比較傳統嘅大陸口音，堂上會問好多問題大家chatbox度簡單幾隻字答下，算多互動&例子教。ppt好少野，上堂會講好多延伸嘅野link去日常生活，算用心教。
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 15%
Lab 15%
Group project 20%
Midterm exam 25%
Final exam 25%
93 攞A （project hea做，考試前睇返slides，都唔知學過啲乜）
reviews.comment_workload:
0 workload，上堂chatbox求其跟其他人打答案答問題就有parti分，無asm，得mt final同埋一個project（only present），極chill掛咗一個sem機。
lab都係無workload，每次上lab會做個quiz（5條mc，無限試錯）。
題外話，成個course最煩係個project，topic係blockchain，佢教嘅時候係大概略過，而我地成組都唔太清楚其實係乜，一開始煩咗幾耐，後尾唔理啦求其講就算。而真present時，佢對每一組都係會講this is a good presentation，似乎係趕時間唔會點評亦無q&a，所以其實係好爽。

reviews.author: hchchc2
reviews.title: Easy course + Nice grading
reviews.comment_content:
Lectures:
- Very easy content even for non-ICT dse students
- Just IT concepts, no calculations

1. Digital Economy
2. E-commerce
3. Online Platforms
4. Databases and Business Analytics
5. Big Data
6. Fintech

Labs:
- Covered some excel techniques, but not hard to follow ; some data retrieving, SQL techniques as well
- Have to finish a small quiz during the lab but the TA would help if you ask them
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Cheung's class is not boring, he has some HK accents though. Lectures are easy to follow, powerpoints are clear but you might need to fill in some blanks for the ppt. But he is very friendly that he gives quite lenient grades and he is always willing to answer our questions, comment on project ideas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite lenient and fair. OK to revise/ read the slides one or two days before exam.

Class Parti: 15/15
- canvas discussion for each topic
- two talks (just attend the zoom talk, if you do not, you can write a short reflection to get the points too)

Labs: 13.67/15
- lab quiz (5/5)
- lab exam (8.67/10)

Group project: -/20
- not released
- but do not freeride because the peer evaluation is important!!

Midterm: 22/25 (mean=20.88, SD=3.135)
- short questions (open book) (ans can be found in ppt)

Final: 22/25
- short questions (open book) (ans can be found in ppt)

Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.

Just one project at the very late weeks of the course + one mt + one final.

One discussion question on canvas for each topic.

Midterm and final are similar, short questions were asked but almost all of the answers can be found in the ppt.

reviews.author: Vicwwk
reviews.comment_content:
Content is very easy to understand without much professional wording.

1. Digital Economy
2. E-commerce
3. Online Platforms
4. Databases and Business Analytics
5. Big Data
6. Fintech
reviews.comment_teaching: very easy to understand and very willing to help when you have question although may not related to the main content
reviews.comment_grading:
I think grading is fair enough but the difference of mark between a sub-grade is very small

Class Pati: 15/15
- online discussion for each module and two talks

Labs: 14.67/15
- every lab tasks which have unlimited trial
- lab exam included in the final

Group project: -/20

Midterm: 24.5/25
- general questions (open book)

Final: 23.5/25
- general questions (open book)

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: no workload at all, only need to write discussion after the finish of modules

reviews.author: tungcc
reviews.title: An easy course
reviews.comment_content:
Very easy topics, which covered some IT related issues + practical skills (SQL commands) If you have studied ICT in DSE , it is easy to catch up since the database topics are ICT elective A stuff.
For the lab, easy technical knowledge covered.  For what I have mentioned, DSE also covered some topics like Excel so you are lucky if you have learnt it before.
reviews.comment_teaching: I love his teaching style. His PowerPoints are clear and short, appropriately 1X-2X pages each chapter. With some point forms and graphs, they made the content easier to study and learn.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade course so far.
5% lab participation (quiz) Me: 5
10% lab exam Me: 7.67/10
20% gp project (grade is not released (yet??)
PS make sure you do not free ride since your weighted score is based on your peer evaluation
15% participation (talks+discussion on canvas) Me: full for talks + idk what score for discussion
25% midterm Me: 47/50
25% final Me: 45/50
Overall grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. Although there are 10 labs, the quizzes are in unlimited attempts so you can just guess the answers and submit. You can try many times to guess the correct answers.
For lecture, each topic will have a discussion in canvas. Just simply apply some knowledge from ppt and answer and you are done with that.
For group projects, very light workload. 1 ppt+presentation and 1 written report. Make sure you have good group mates.
For the guest talks, although you have cameras on, you can just do whatever you want. Make sure you attend the two talks in person in zoom rather than writing a report for that if you are free, that’s a light workload!!!
(This just applies to zoom learning)

reviews.author: Stellar123
reviews.title: Light workload
reviews.comment_content: Others have mentioned the course content already so I don’t repeat here.  The content is easy to understand.  Be careful about the pricing calculations though.  Make sure you do understand and practise.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice and clear teaching with lots of interaction.  Professor is very willing to answer student’s questions, be it email or asking in class.  He replies emails relatively fast too.
reviews.comment_grading: As the content is easy, you can easily get a good grade as long as you listen in class.  For the group project, the SD is not very large (around 1.X% out of 20%).
reviews.comment_workload:
Super light workload.
Midterm 25%
Final 25%
Participation 15%
Group project 20%
Lab 15% (Includes lab final and lab quizzes)

reviews.author: LALA8310
reviews.title: Acceptable Course
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy, E-Commerce, Online Platforms, Business Analytics, Big Data Analytics

Simple content, introduce some basic concepts, theories and terms, like long-tail effect, sponsor advertisement
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor from mainland, with serious accent, actually, it require efforts to understand what she is saying.

Yet, it is okay if you just skip all the lectures and tutorials, only attend the industry week workshop x 2.  All the exam content will be included in the powerpoint, although the powerpoint is somehow messy, but what you have to understand is the theories. What I did is look for what theories included in the ppt, then learn it by myself online.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation 15% Labs 15%
Group Project 20% Midterm Exam 20% Final Exam 30%

The grading is not satisfied.
For me, the score it released (Midterm,Exams for both lecture and tutorial) is higher than mean about 0.5 sd. The socre of gp project and class participation didnt release. I got a C which is lower than my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is relatively fair.
No assignment, gp project in late sem.
weekly tutorial and quiz (simple ans easy quiz)

Midterm and exam are easy as well, very straightforward.

reviews.author: wefe232
reviews.title: Not very good grade
reviews.comment_content: He asked what we wanted to learn in the course and he really taught us about those topics that we were interested in.
reviews.comment_teaching: Neither boring but nor very interesting, he gave enough examples and explanations so it was not difficult to understand the topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
mean = C+
We had online lessons and exams this semester, so everyone got a high score, more than half of the class got full marks in one of the exam papers. The S.D. was very small so you had to avoid any careless mistakes. I got a B+ for about 1 S.D. above mean.
reviews.comment_workload:
No heavy, just one reading passage and one project.
However, the workload will be quite heavy during project presentations as you have to give feedback immediately after presentations of other groups. The feedback will be rated by the group so people usually write very long feedback.

reviews.author: helloworld69
reviews.title: A really chill course
reviews.comment_content: You basically learn how an information system is being applied to business. For example, you get to know about Digital Economy, E-commerce, Online Platforms, Business Analytics, and Big Data Analytics. None of these topics really go in-depth though. You also get to learn some really easy programming skills in tutorials such as using Microsoft Access, Excel VBA ...... In the middle of the semester, you will also be attending industry talk and gain an insight of different business sectors from professionals working inside. Overall, it is quite an all-rounded course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was okay. Her pronunciation sometimes is difficult to understand but overall I think it is acceptable. She also used a lot of examples in her teaching to illustrate the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
The questions in the midterm and final were extremely easy and straightforward

For the midterm, the mean is 16.16/20 and the sd is 2.02.

While for final, the mean for lecture part is 25.44 / 30 and the sd is 3.18, the mean for lab part is 6.86 / 10 and the sd is 2.46

Although I got below mean for midterm, I got near full mark in both parts of the final and got an A at last.
reviews.comment_workload: This is one of the courses that I had the most relaxing time with. There basically wasn't much assignment to do. The only big one is the group project, which my group had coordinated extremely well. It didn't really cost me much time. (and I guess we got a really well grade as well )

reviews.author: 好好學習

整個吹水科，冇任何實質內容，浪費時間學啲垃圾嘢。
呢個學期最憎就係呢一科。
學唔到嘢+workload大+爛龜

He always says DON'T... I WILL NOT ANSWER YOUR QUESTION...

一句講曬，垃圾啦即係。唔想再見到佢。

midterm啲MC題目又難極，final又淺極搞到人人滿分。

reviews.author: little ass
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy
E-Commerce
Online Platforms
Industry Week
Business Analytics
Big Data Analytics
Emerging Technology: Blockchain

only this prof covered blockchain I believe, which is interesting and practical to me
reviews.comment_teaching: korean professor, not bad, I like him, he's friendly, but he does sometimes overrun/ rush the last part of lectures
reviews.comment_grading:
alright, midterm mean, project and final exam unreleased, b+,
no idea how class participation was done

reviews.comment_workload:
have to do group project, design an app
exam more on memorisation, memorise everything on the slides he covered during exam review section

reviews.author: 御前带瓜侍卫
reviews.title: She doesn't know what she is talking about
reviews.comment_content: It's about the developments of IT, including topics like E-commerce, big data and FinTech. Lectures emphasizes concepts and definitions, while labs focus on the technical things. However, there is no relationship between lectures and labs. And the contents for lab sessions are too difficult for a student without CS knowledge like me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To be honest, she is enthusiastic about teaching and tried to make the lectures more interesting, but she always failed.
There's no logic in her slides nor in her lectures. I recommend skipping all lectures and make good use of Google to help you understand the concepts in her slides.
Also, she seems to be not clear about her expectations for students. The project requirements kept changing and the only way you can get a clear answer is to ask her in Mandarin. Read every slide throughly and do not trust the syllabus or project grading criteria. She makes changes to them every week.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is actually quite lenient.
Midterm(20%): below mean 0.2sd because I get 3 MCs wrong, each of them worths 6 points.Ridiculous.
Final(30%): above mean 0.5sd
Lab(5%attendance+10%final): full attendance. Final above mean 0.5sd
Participation(15%): full attendance for industry week(5%). The syllabus says 10% comes from participation in the project but we didn't have peer evaluation, so I wonder how can she grade us.
Project(20%): not released.
Finally I get B+, which is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light. The most demanding part is the project, but it's still manageable unless the group is full of free-riders. For exams, just try to understand every concept in the exam guides.

reviews.author: Pitch
reviews.title: Very useful class
reviews.comment_content: Lecture content slides are pretty useful as the prof takes a lot of her lecture content from different books and digest them into the notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Try to sit in front of the class because it will be easy to fall asleep in her class for two reasons: 1. her tone can be quite boring 2. it is a big LT so sitting further back will get you distracted.

however, when it comes to class presentations Q&A time, she is extremely sharp which makes you think a lot about your business idea (final class project was to develop a business idea using an emerging technology). I love her questions as they are all very challenging. P.s. if you make pretty slides, she will like it very much!
reviews.comment_grading:
Wasn't too sure on the grading curve as I didn't really track it but overall A+. I think this was due to two reasons:

1. I studied for the midterm and final by compiling all her lecture notes together into one document (20/30 pages long). Just copy and paste them because her slides are all in PPT with different sizes so making them into one WORD document with one font size was much better for revision. The midterm & final content didn't deviate much from classroom notes.

2. I studied really hard for the coding parts of the LAB sessions. If you want to ensure you get an overall A grade, DO NOT SKIP  YOUR REVISION OVER THE LAB SESSIONS. REPEAT- MAKE SURE YOU UNDERSTAND THE STUDY GUIDE. This is the make-it-or-break-it for finals, not the classroom notes.

3. ATTEND the midterm and final review sessions. It's actually all that was necessary for me, at least for students who like to skip class.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework, so its quite light. The projects can be a bit tough if you change it midway so try to think strategically when selecting your idea for the project since you will be doing it the whole term. Besides, there will be 1-2 impromptu iLearn quiz that she will have but it is super easy.

reviews.author: nahhhhhh
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy
E-Commerce
Digital Intelligence
Database
Platform
Big Data and Business Analytics
Emerging Technologies: Blockchain
reviews.comment_teaching: Typical Korean Accent, need a few lectures to adopt to it, but overall it's find because everything you need to know for passing mid terms and exams are in the lecture notes. Prof Lee is the only prof teaching about blockchain tech, if you want to know more about blockchain you can take his course. He also gives us a lot of real life example and youtube videos to elaborate his teaching, which is perfect for me to understand when he is teaching complicated topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
Nice, although I worked very hard.

Full mark in every lab quizzes.

For projects, my team got the best presentation among those presented in the same day according to iPRS.
1.5 SD above mean for mid term
Final exam marks is not reviewed.

final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Only a group project, which consist of 6 people. You need to form your own group, be care of who you choose, A LOT OF FREERIDER, i got 2 in my team. You will work as if you are in hell, if your groupmates freerided you, because the project is quite demanding.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content:
The more you can memorize, the higher grade you can get. The topics in this course are not really too IS related. So, don't expect too much on this course if you wanna learn IS stuff.

Topics:
1. Digital Economy
2. E-Commerce
3. Digital Intelligence
4. Database
5. Online Platforms
6. Big Data and Business Analytics
7. Emerging Technologies in IS: Blockchain
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture: So boring. Half of the classes skipped the lecture. I remembered there was a lecture crashed with the MidTerm Peak, then the number of people attended was just ard 10-15 even though it was a 3 pm class.

Lab: Fair, teaching coding, programming and computer software something like that. The TA is fair as well. Her pace was acceptable though her voice was too sharp to listen.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't even know how does my letter grade come from. No statistics, no transparency, no reply from TA.

10% Class Participation (unknown)
15% Labs (online quizzes: 5/5+ Lab Final Exam 10% unknown)
20% Group Project (unknown)
25% Midterm Exam: 65/100 (Mean: 70)
30% Final Exam (unknown)

Final Grade: B

Exams are not cumulative.
He loved asking nonsense, trivial and detailed questions omg. He won't ask you the basic and the important knowledge.

I hate the TA as he will never reply to your email and won't answer your questions accurately.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab: Compulsory and take attendance. You can ask your friends to help you sign if you wanna skip the lab but remember to finish the quiz on time since the time limited is 40 minutes only and will be closed afterwards.

Lecture: No attendance except for the presentation days and Industry Week. Project has a heavy workload since you have to hand in a proposal, the presentation and the final report.

15 minutes presentation + Q&A and 8 pages report required. The timeslot of presentation is FCFS basis. If your group cannot reserve the time slot as quick as others. Then, good luck for your presentation.

reviews.author: Trafalgar Law
reviews.title: From my perspective, it's not as bad as people say...
reviews.comment_content: Ummm Actually the content is really boring (kind of), and a lot of things to memorise during exam. But it's a compulsory course anyway (for business students)
reviews.comment_teaching: I think he teaches well coz his lesson is funny and he raises interesting examples. Although sometimes it's kind of boring (due to the boring content of the course), but he did try his best to make it fun
reviews.comment_grading:
It's controversal. I get a slightly-below mean in midterm and I was depressed... Nevertheless, I get one of the best score in group presentation and a good final score. It turns out I got an A.
Midterm:
mean: 28.2/34 High:33.5/34 Me: 27.81/34
Final:
mean: 38/49, high: 49/49, Me: 44/49
Final (lab):
mean: 38.7, high: 50/50, me: 47/50
Group presentation;

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Not as good as it was rated
reviews.comment_content:
As somebody else here has said, basically an introduction to consultancy or strategic management instead of information system. Maybe it's useful for case coms, but I believe this course isn't designed to prepare us for case coms... If a huge chunk of the whole course is just packed with the so-called "managerial insights" without the most basic technical detail, it's misleading in the sense that it's telling us as if IS major does not involve much technical stuff.

🔷 Digital Economy
🔷 E-Commerce
🔶 Online Platforms
🔶 Social Media
🔷🔶 Software
🔷🔶 Hardware
🔶 Databases and Business Analytics
🔶 Big data
🔶 Crowdsourcing

🔷 IT Fundamentals
🔶 IT Trends

The lab section is slightly more relevant. We're introduced with business analytics using Excel VBA and big data analytics using Microsoft Azure. But you need a little bit of statistics background (e.g. simple linear regression, the concept of R-square, etc) to better understand what the heck is going on.

🔷 Google Web Analytics
🔷 Microsoft Access Database Management
🔷 Business Analytics with Microsoft Excel
🔷 Advanced Business Analytics with Excel VBA
🔷 Big Data Analytics with Microsoft Azure

Overall the course could have been better structured to reflect and give us a preview of how the IS major is like.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Probably Tat Koon is limited by the crappy design of the course content, but I'm afraid to say that his lectures really add no values to enhancing our understanding of the course materials. He has a tendency to over-explain simple stuff and initiates discussion on issues that are already trivial to most of us. That's why I decided to skip almost all lectures after the midterm.

The most disappointing part is how he handled the course console issue. He could have easily known that the server couldn't handle such a large course when he picked a plan in which the max_connection parameter is merely 30. (WTF??) Throughout the whole process he reacted in a way hoping the situation would "automatically" get better by extending deadlines, but every one of us knew that the minor stuff couldn't solve the problem at all. It wasn't until the third round of presentation when he came up with a more reasonable solution of utilizing the Google Forms to replace the course console. Thanks to his "timely" response a lot of us stayed in front of our laptops the whole night refreshing the course console website in frustration (which worsened the situation).

Btw the hidden messages in his ppt are just words in white that can be easily revealed by a PDF editor like Adobe Acrobat.

On the other hand, the lab TA has an annoying Hong Kong Chinglish accent and a mosquito-like sharp voice that drives you nuts. But other than her English proficiency everything else is fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
❓ 20% Class participation
💻 15% Labs
💬✏️ 20% Group project
✏️ 20% Midterm exam
✏️ 25% Final exam

Absurd non-sense. 15% out of the 20% class participation is based on how the other project groups rated your feedback of their own presentations. (Read: NEVER give low marks to them even if their work is sh!t, or they revenge by giving you a low rating in return) The other 5% is basically the online assignments that are posted on Canvas "secretly", i.e. you don't even know the existence of the assignments if you don't check the Canvas regularly. The assignments are basically a piece of cake for us, but since nobody ever mentions that the assignments are released, if you miss them, you lose the marks. You're graded based on whether you check the Canvas or not.

Tat Koon claimed that he aimed to increase the weighting of the group project and decrease the weighting of exams, but he beat his own mouth by giving us more or less similar scores in the group project. As it turned out exams were still the dominant factor that differentiated A's, B's and C's. The group project? In IS terms, non-negotiable but also a non-differentiator of your grade. Just finish the project. DON'T put too much effort into it.

We were also somehow misled into thinking that the lab final exam was a part the 25% of the final exam, but it turned out that it was 10% out of the 15% of the lab part. Thus actual weighting of all exams combined is 55%, more important than it seems.

Midterm
Mean = 28.2/34. SD = 3. I got 1.13 SD above mean.

Final
Mean = 38/49. SD = 6.8. I got around 1.25 SD above mean.

Lab final
Mean = 38.7/50. SD = 6.9. I got around 1.35 SD above mean.

Project presentation
Our group was one of the groups that scored the minimum, but it was still a 9/10. The highest was 9.8. With such small standard deviation, it doesn't really matter whether your group did well or not in the project.

I believe all of us were taken by surprise with such a technically oriented final exam. mySQL was heavily tested and the proportion of long questions asking on those managerial insights were greatly reduced.

Benefiting from this exam-oriented grading scheme, I got an A at the end.

Btw there is no correlation between active participation in class and the final grade. I got an A even though I am an introvert that never spoke up in class, and I skipped a lot of lessons as well.
reviews.comment_workload:
The group project is supposed to be the biggest chunk of workload, but I got carried by 2 GBUSers who were dominant and always changed what others had written. But this also meant I got lighter workload.

Exams - nothing much you can do. Just cram everything 1 hour before the exams and then you'll do decently well. There isn't much content in the first place.

Feel free to skip lectures - you won't miss anything if you skip all of them. And again, simply use a PDF editor to reveal the hidden lines in his lecture slides.

Labs - compulsory attendance. The stupid thing is that even if you finish the lab early you still have to wait till the quiz is unlocked (40 minutes after the lab has started) to get the marks.

reviews.author: Kezy
reviews.title: Good Course + Instructor
reviews.comment_content: Introduction course for Information Systems. Covers content including but not limited to Big Data, E-commerce, Platforms, Social Media Management, Software, Crowdsourcing etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Koh teaches really well and makes the class really interesting by giving good examples to illustrate his ideas and get the class to participate in discussions. The things that he mentions in class will also be related to the questions that will appear in the exams, so paying attention would be beneficial.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, but very evenly distributed across participation, group project, peer evaluation, midterm and final exam (Almost 20% each). This is good for people who put effort into studying this course but can be detrimental for those who rely on exams to get a decent grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There isn't any homework given, but you will have to work on the group project pretty often and do lab quizzes every week. The majority of the workload would happen during the final presentations, where you will have to write a substantial amount of evaluation for the other groups' presentations, and they are usually due on the same night. So imagine if you had your IS class at 12 and have classes all the way until 6. That would mean that you only have around a few hours to do the evaluations (which would be graded based on its quality).

reviews.author: n1l0h3i0
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term:
1. Digital Economy
2. E-commerce
---------------------
Final:
3. Online Platform
4. Business Analytics
5. Big-data Analytics
6. Emerging Technology
-----------------------

Overall, the course provides a broad and surface-level understanding of ISOM, covering content on digital technology, e-commerce, business analytics, platform business, big data, and cryptocurrency. On the other hand, the lab content is slightly more practical, covering basic VBA, Microsoft Access, and machine learning. The downside is that the TA does not explain the reasoning behind each step in detail. Overall, the course and lab content are not very useful, as they do not provide in-depth knowledge or skills. To put it in perspective, the lab material can be learned within a day, and the course content is simple and straightforward.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is hard to stay motivated to attend the classes, I missed most of the lectures since mid-term. The class is not very engaging, as the professor mostly reads from the PowerPoint slides, making it easy to lose focus. Additionally, the professor has a strong Korean accent, but fortunately, everything he says is on the slides, which makes it easier to understand. Some terms and theories are poorly explained, and the professor often paraphrases the concepts instead of adding new perspectives. However, both the professor and TAs are friendly and quick to respond to emails.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
- Lab: 15% (Quizzes: 5% + Final exam: 10%)
- Participation: 15% (based on attending group project presentation)
- Group project: 20% (includes proposal, presentation, and report)
- Mid-term exam: 20%
- Final exam: 30% (non-cumulative)

Mid-term exam:
- Mean: 73.32
- Lower quartile: 68
- Median: 76.5
- Upper quartile: 82

Overall performance:
- Lab quizzes: full credit received (unlimited attempts)
- Mid-term exam: 78.5
- Final exam, lab final, group project and participation: not released
- Final grading: A

Considering the surprise A received despite the mid-term performance, the grading should be lenient and nice.
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall, the workload for this course is relatively light.
However, it is important to note that the mid-term and final exams require memorizing all the details from the lecture slides, similar to the DSE exams.
The group project workload is manageable if you are able to find a good teammate to work with.

reviews.author: Alp1ne
reviews.comment_content: About the basics of Information System. The material covers Digital Economy, E-commerce (google and chatgpt), Business Analytics and Fintech. The contents are sometimes professional and hard for you to participate in class if you are not familiar with them. But most of the time they are quite easy for understanding. The exams are non-cumulative and quite easy as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very kind and helpful. You can ask her every questions concerning the topic after class and this can even be counted into class participation. However, sometimes she doesn't avoid using some unfamiliar and professional words, which may lead to confusion. She could also use a lot of time answering questions, which would be boring.
reviews.comment_grading: The participation is mainly about the industrial week speeches, and in-class participation is not the most important part. However, you do have to ask or answer questions in class because they are recorded after class. The professor doesn't take attendance. Only questions matters. The exam and the group project contribute most to the course grade. Since the materials are easy, the mean is usually very high and the sd is quite small. AND PLEASE TREAT YOUR PROJECT SERIOUSLY
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload for most of the semester. The group project is the only assignment for the whole semester. Also you don't need to present your project.

reviews.author: Human_01
reviews.comment_content:
(Please read others' 2022–2023 spring reviews first before reading my comment. Because most of what I want to say has already been said by others, I won't say it again.)
 
I think the content in the lab is way more useful than that in lectures.
Eg. Excel, Excel VBA, Access 

And something funny is that, because of the participation claiming policy, most of the class time is wasted on unnecessary Q&A, in which these extra content will not be tested. Meanwhile it delayed the class schedule, so she cut some of the topics stated in the syllabus. It turns out that, in the non-cumulative final exam, only content from the last 3 lectures(most are SQL, which overlab with those in lab, & Fintech) is tested. You can just watch the recording and learn everything one day before the final exam. (And my friend in Prof. Lee session had way more content to be tested in the final, eg. Big data ? I forgot , which I never learned from Prof. Chen)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Understandable accent and teaching.
Professor is nice, but the presentation is a little sloppy. She tried to be fun, which I think is good. 

Kind TA but quick teaching without stopping. You better self-learn b4 attending lab lessons, or skip all lab and learn on Youtube, or simply read the note is also fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
I thought it would be bad, but it turned out to be good for me. 

Tho the transparency is low. You will only know your lab quiz and midterm marks. Mark of other component will not be disclosed. No paper check for the final exam. 

The midterm exam is poorly designed. Some MC's answer is so obvious while some wording are so unclear. The midterm only lasted 30 minutes, with 8 MC (2 was cancelled after paper check) and 1 SQ. Full marks = 48, Mean = 44.18. SD=4.44
reviews.comment_workload:
Ppl cheat on participation points.

The only workload comes from group projects. It is like 6 ppl in a group, choosing one article out of the three she provided, buying it (yes, you have to pay), and making a 30-35 page ppt and a 5-page report. Instructions are not so clear. 

Be careful when choosing groupmate. You will cry if your groupmate not cooperate. I cried.  :(

reviews.comment_teaching:
Terrible. Don't expect any from her. She has mainland accent but that's tolerable. It isn't the issue. The thing is - Her PowerPoints are chaotic. Points jump here and there and the pages are not coherent. You will not understand the core messages she wants to convey during lessons.

The WORST thing is the participation part. You have the answer/ raise questions during lessons and claim your participation credit on Canvas afterwards. It makes people simply just wonder what to ask her instead of focusing on course content. I personally use a trick by asking chatgpt what can I ask the professor on the topic xyz.

And when you ask her questions, often she can't really give you a concrete answer. Sometimes she even repeats the question and asks the students back.

Lab teaching is fine. I'm in Olivia's class. A little bit too fast but she explains clearly when you ask her questions (unlike our DEAR professor I'm sorry)

Some of the MCs are poorly asked and some are too trivial. Long question are just bluffing (7 marks for a question short question). You can see the mean is crazily high as well. To get good grades I think work hard + luck to successfully read yanzhen's mind.

reviews.author: Apple01
reviews.title: Good grade, nice professor
reviews.comment_content: Just refer to other comments. One thing to mention, you need to jot notes or else you may find some content could be a little bit unclear. The slides are organised in a clean and tidy way.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a mainland professor, but his English is just fine. At least I am sure that everyone could understand him. His pace is relatively slow but clear. He also encourages everyone to answer his questions. Feel free to contact him after class if you have any questions regarding the materials. I think he is very helpful and would somehow inspire you. Yet, he didn't really care for the group project. Even if you asked him questions regarding the project, he would just hea respond to you.
One thing to mention, I saw a comment saying he is a bit bossy. But I think as the comment said, he just needs basic respect. Be a responsible student and control your volume especially when your professor's teaching is not hea. You can see from his eyes that he is actually quite passionate about teaching this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good. I have only answered around 3 questions in the class and got full marks for my discussion contribution. Make sure you have joined the Canvas discussion and the lecture which has in-class discussion. Everyone would get parti if you attended the lecture since he would come to each seat and ask questions.
For the lecture exam (Mid-Term and Final), just make sure you understand each topic. Topics are quite easy to handle since most of them are just blowing water. I think for an average person, you just need to spend a few hours before the lecture exam if you have paid attention to the lecture. For the lab exam, it just questions repeating the lab quiz. So make sure you understand the lab quiz. You can do the unlimited exercise provided by TA before the Lab exam on Canvas. If you could get the full marks and understand each question, I think that'll be np for the lab exam.
For the group project, while you are presenting, the professor won't actually give af at all. I remember after the presentation, I sat behind the prof and saw him doing his own work for the groups he was not interested in, and only raised his head and clapped at the end of those presentations. But I think you will get 18/20 even if you performed not that well since he didn't really give af at all. If you really want to get the full mark, make sure you make your idea interesting.

My grade: A
Discussion Contribution: 15/15
Lab: 13.5/15
Group Project: 18/20
Midterm Exam: 22/25
Final Exam: 20.75/25
Mean: 78.51, SD: 8.66
And that's my first A in UST. He is the nicest UST professor I've met ngl.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework, no report. Just presentation slides, lab quizzes and exams. I actually skipped half of the labs since you have unlimited attempts for lab quizzes.

reviews.author: 科大公道伯
reviews.title: 其實有d後悔冇認真上堂聽+經常走堂
reviews.comment_content:
其實就係講 e-commerce 講下有咩theory之類
好容易明 不過要真係應用+解釋嗰陣冇想像中咁易
我覺得係一個easy course 俾人刷靚grade用
想入isom maj就擺多小小effort都夠做
reviews.comment_teaching:
我覺得xu hong真係有料 平時上堂有d international同學舉出一啲佢地local嘅e-commerce例子 xu hong都知道係咩 仲可以俾到further elaboration
平時上堂的確有小小悶 但其實真係專心聽 你會真係feel到佢有料
特別係做project嗰陣 我地一開始啲idea係俾佢ban到傻 佢總係能夠係你想像唔到嘅位置 精闢咁點出有咩問題 都間接逼到我地做到一份更好嘅project 我係幾鍾意佢

不過好笑嘅係 上堂太嘈佢會惡同鬧人 如果落堂太多人問佢嘢阻佢收工 佢都會唔耐煩 果然係打工仔 笑死
reviews.comment_grading:
正常我覺得 最後B+ 冇點溫書去考算係咁

midtern：41/50 （Mean: 39.41 Median: 40）
final：5g
project：5g
attendance：應該滿分掛 兩次iprs都有做
lab：.....我最後一次唔記得做 哭𠹌咗
但我地project應該做得唔錯 因為每組做完之後 xuhong都有有好犀利好尖銳嘅問題去問佢地 但我地組冇 seems冇咩可以挑剔
同埋事前我都有同佢講過我地個project嘅focus point係咩 佢有表示interesting（微微露出喜悅神情）同埋覺得唔錯 加上有係交project之前比佢睇一次佢再比comment我地 我地再改先再交

btw xuhong唔重視presentation skill 但好重視你d content
9成人都係上去讀稿 but seems係冇問題 佢大部分時間都係一邊寫一邊聽你講同睇ppt 好少睇你個人present

重點：有好groupmate carry你好重要
reviews.comment_workload:
sem尾個project有d辛苦同chur 因為佢嘅要求都幾harsh
希望你唔好講一d大部分惡commerce都有嘅問題
要搵到嗰個e commerce專有問題
所以我地都砍掉重練咗兩次份project
但平時又冇功課 final 同 midterm又唔係話好多嘢考
final小小tricky咁 我覺得其實算輕鬆
at least我係冇點擺effort係讀書同溫書方面

P.S佢會突然有iprs 好彩兩次我都係度
lab就小煩 我冇去過 每個禮拜撞答案 笑死

reviews.author: Aud
reviews.title: Unexpected good professor
reviews.comment_content: refer to previous reviews plz

Unexpected good professor in UST. You will never want to sleep during his lesson even it is a 9 am class(probably because he is a bit bossy JUST A BIT A BIT!! He once looked at a girl and asked her to get out of the classroom if she talked once more, that lesson was super depressed) He needs student to be quiet during lessons, giving him the basic respect.

the only part that explains less detail would be blockchain, you may need to watch some youtube videos to understand the concept

reviews.author: Mochi
reviews.comment_content: Digital Economy(1-3) --> E-Commerce(1-4) --> Midterm Exam --> Digital Platform(1-3) --> Big Data(1-4) --> Group Project Presentation --> Final Exam
reviews.comment_teaching: Easy to understand. You can understand his lecture clearly and the PPT is very clear to read. He asks many questions in class, and you can earn credit for your participation by answering his question.
reviews.comment_grading:

Lab 15%
Group project 20%
Midterm exam 25% (large sd)
Final exam 25%

Final mark (above mean 0.4 sd) -> final grade B+

Pretty low.

1 mid-term,1 final exam, 10 lab quizzes, and 1 group project.

reviews.author: Christyyynys
reviews.title: NICE
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very easy and subjective.
You do not have to be hard work in this course as the content is like common sense. Even if you do not study, you may get a higher grade than your friends.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His slides are all pictures and grades.
He keeps calling all the students to answer his question during the lesson. I would say his explanation is okay but not very clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
All people get full marks in participation grades whether they have answered to not. 15/15

The prof. did not count attendance so you can choose to skip the lesson if you're busy.

below mean in the midterm and above mean in the final exam. Turns out A grade.
So, Don't worry if you got bad results in the midterm, you still have a chance to choose IS major.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light.
As the midterm and final exams are open-booked.
But, I will say his exam test is slightly different compared to the lecture notes.

reviews.author: Selenee
reviews.comment_content:

She really do not checked the attendance but sometimes she's checking it via iprs.

Everything is find except for Research Project.

It was a group group activity of 5 to 6 people. Project requires you to write 12 pages of report and you have to presentation in class around 15 minutes per slot. After you presentation, professor will ask you few questions and it was quite tough.

No quiz. No homework.

reviews.comment_content:
four main topics

project on E-commerce platform
reviews.comment_teaching: Interactive and interesting instructor, gave a clear speech and examples during class, and many questions for students to earn the discussion contribution credit
