reviews.author: 清水灣廢青
reviews.title: Quite good, manageable workload with satisfying grading
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture: some are common sense while some are useful (especially Fintech). Mostly test about memorising skills.
For LQ: remember to write as much as you can. I was faked by the TA that no need to write that much. As long as you hit the keypoint, you obtain the marks.
Lab session: quite useful for beginner. Learning Excel, VBA, SQL
SQL is tested in both lab and lecture. SQL is so important in this course. You can surf the internet to find out practise website. Don't be too lazy to think that some complicated syntax will not be tested. This year, the SQL is way more complicated than just simple syntax, requiring joint table, group by and so on......
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring lecture. But she is very nice, good and enthusiastic. PPT is not very organised. It takes time to understand the whole picture. But it is still okay for you to just look at the notes to get the contents.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is good under HKUST, may be our group project is outstanding.
Mid term(20%): getting exactly mean
Final Lab(10%): around mean (didn't show the new mean after grade adjustment)
Final Lect(30%): above 3 marks, ~0.4sd (didn't show the new mean after grade adjustment)
Report (20%) not show
Lab parti(5%): full (normal people get full <= attendance)
Lecture Parti and Project Parti(15%): not show, should be everyone full except those free riders being reported
For me, I get B+ with the above scores. It is actually very good.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload. Non-cumulative. Project is the most demanding part as you need to make slides as well as a 3-pages report. NO PRESENTATION THIS YEAR in this professor's lecture, while other professors require presentation.
Just memorising the lecture materials.
Remember don't fully rely on the summary sheet provided by professor. It is fake. This year, the final asked about Bitcoin ownership and something related to Bitcoin, for example, how the private and public keys generated. These are not shown in the summary sheet. Be well-prepared by preparing both summary sheet and memorising the PPT. Sometimes, google will help you a lot as well, concepts like bitcoin, the five forces(can't remember the name LOL).

reviews.author: little potatoo
reviews.comment_content:
COURSE DESCRIPTION
In virtually every industry and every firm, information technology is driving change, creating opportunities and challenges. Leaders who fail to understand the operational and strategic importance of information systems (IS) will not be able to keep up with the pace of their competitors. IS have moved beyond the automation of back office functions into the foreground of business strategy, and play critical roles in competitive positioning and business process design.
This course provides a broad coverage of technology concepts and trends underlying current and future developments in information technology (IT), and fundamental principles for the effective use of computer- based information systems. There will be a special emphasis on e-commerce, business integration and IT management. Other topics include: hardware/software, networking, the Internet and World Wide Web (WWW), databases, security, and enterprise applications. In additional to the fundamental conceptual and propositions in the IS area, a number of business applications and cases will be discussed; the newest trend in today’s technology domain will also be discussed.

reviews.author: gochiak
reviews.title: PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE YOU ENROLL IN HER CLASS
reviews.comment_content: There are quite a lot of lectures and topics but it mostly deals with e-commerce, big data, social media and the likes
reviews.comment_teaching: The most interesting part about this course is the instructor -- xu hong -- because quite frankly she is irrational and deep down i think she has MAJOR trust issues. Honestly, I do not see any rationale in the way she grades and neither does she give you any recommendations as to how to improve the paper. Firstly, the project proposal we gave her received only very little comments, the presentation itself, she had only one question but the overall score for the paper was sooo low that it brought the grades of all of my group mates down. Not only that, the questions she gave to the other groups seemed rather hostile and derogatory. It almost seems as if she was really trying to bring them down as if she takes some joy out of doing it. Every time I go up to her to ask a question in class, she responds with a flurry of questions that only confused and discouraged to learn more about the course's content. Truth be told, this is the most appalling course AND EDUCATOR that I have ever encountered in my life PERIOD
reviews.comment_grading: Weighing is probably already in the previous reviews but one thing i can say is that the standard deviation for the midterm and final are soooo little that it is absolutely impossible to achieve a score that is very different from your peers which means that in order for your score to differentiate in a good way and be above your peers. you'd have to do well on your GROUP PROJECT. Attendance is also graded sometimes...whenever she feels like it
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fairly appropriate. It consists of a midterm, a final, and a group project that involves a presentation and a written report

reviews.author: 芊滺
reviews.comment_content:
1. Digital Economy
2. E-commerce
3. Social media
4.Technical Foundations
5. Big Data
6. Business Analytics and Decision Makings
7. Business, Accounting, and Finance
8. Technology-Enabled Business Trends

Participation 10%
In-Class Exercises 5%
Labs 15%
Research Project 20%
Midterm Exam 20%
Final Exam 30%
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is very easy to understand. However, there are lab sessions that everyone is required to take, which is more difficult compared to the lectures. For the lab, 5% for the attendance and 10% for the exam.
reviews.comment_grading: I have no idea how she grades. There is no results released for the final exam and project.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is moderate, just exams and project. Read the notes before the exam and you will understand the content. However, if you want to score high, you have to work so hard since everyone is getting a very high mark.

reviews.author: lmk
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting which introduces the application of data in real life business like the Google and Amazon models. Also, it provides the basic knowledge of data analysis and computerized skills like the VBA in Excel. No complicated Maths concepts are included so it is not so difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: The explanation is clear but it is not included in the lecture notes so you need to drop it down and be concentrated, The professor is willing to spend time to answer your questions and she is very nice.
reviews.comment_grading: The Midterm is very easy and the mean is very high. The requirements of the project is not so clear as the area is too board. The Final is harder which is the major element to indicate your grade. You need to attend the lessons as the participation is taken randomly.
reviews.comment_workload: Only a Project (Presentation + Final report), Midterm and Final Exam. No homework is required. The report is 12 pages only so it does not take too much time to finish it. It is suggested to start doing it earlier as you can consult the professor to improve your project.

reviews.author: SomeoneInUST2
reviews.title: Good Professor Good Introductory Business Course
reviews.comment_content:
The name is "Information System" so it talks about what is IS in business with real-life examples (though a bit old...)

The content composes of Lectures & Labs. Lab is held once every week for one hour in LSK. Lecture is teaching + presentation by the students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Xu Hong is very very good ！Highly recommend to take her courses. She is professional in this field and always try to provide useful examples.

Despite looking serious, she is very nice so don't hesitate to approach her : )
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is good.

Final exam is non-culminative but also includes lab content. Team project is important and make sure to do something the professor is interested in.

In fact, it is hard for me to get up at 9am so I barely attend the lectures but I review the lectures PPTs. My team is super great and our project evokes Professor Xu's interest.

My mid-term & final are slightly above mean (not more than 1 sd though..)
Research project & presentation ==> I think it's good.
Final grade : B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light just need to attend the mandatory labs and presentation sessions. You will be good.

reviews.author: Eunice cheng
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy (I)
Digital Economy (II)
Digital Economy (III)
E-Commerce (I)
E-Commerce (II)
E-Commerce (III)
Digital Intelligence (I)
Digital Intelligence (II)
Database
Online Platforms (I)
Online Platforms (II)
Big Data and Business Analytics (I)
Big Data and Business Analytics (II)
Emerging Technologies in IS: Blockchain
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a new professor at HKUST but his lecture is interesting and easy to understand. However, some of the powerpoints are too long, you are required to watch the teaching videos after lectures.No video will be uploaded to Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good grade.
Class Participation10%
Labs15%
Group Project20%
Midterm Exam25%
Final Exam30%
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload
The major workload is the project. As you have to prepare the proposal, powerpoint presentation as well as the written report for the project.
There is no HW in the lab and the quizzes after lab have unlimited attempts.

reviews.author: jparkar
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of Information Systems could be learned throughout the course. Topics covered include:

-Digital Economy
-E-commerce
-Social Media
-Technical Foundations
-Big Data
-Business Analytics and Decision Makings

This course also provides lab sessions using Microsoft Azure Machine Learning, Microsoft Excel and basic data analytics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is fine. She basically goes through the slides and shows videos in-class. Although attendance is not compulsory, it is advised to go as she seldom asks students to answer some questions in-class. If you have any queries you can always email her as she was one of the professors who replied quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
-Discussions and you need to submit 1-page report for industry week talks. You can get them easily if you won't miss the class.

In-Class Exercises 5%
-Some of the exercises in the class. Usually short answer questions.

Labs15%
-Every lab has attendance and in-class quiz. You can try the quiz as much as you want before the class ends. There is plenty time for you to finish so it is not a problem.

Research Project 20%
-This is what matters. Six students in a group and you will get to choose your own group mates. You will get to choose one topic from two topics and have to make outline, powerpoint slides and report from the research that you have done. You will need to do presentation in front of whole class and the professor of course. Peer-evaluation is included and you also need to attend other sessions to get participation marks. Following deadlines are key to success

Midterm Exam 20%
-Covers the materials in lecture slides and reading materials. Most of them are multiple choice questions and short answers. Not difficult and quite high mean.

Final Exam 30%
-Similar to mid-term exam. Not Cumulative. The only thing different is it includes lab exam. What you have learnt in lab session is tested and has higher weight compare to the lecture session. Don't try to give up on lab. You will ruin your final.

I got overall grade A but as there are many students aiming for IS as their major, it is very competitive.
reviews.comment_workload:
As you need to do lab, mid-term, final, project report, presentation, managing your time is really important.

Good Luck! :)

reviews.author: smile:)
reviews.title: GO FOR XU, HONG !
reviews.comment_content:
basic IS concept, nth difficult
you will understand the lecture even you don't attend the lecture
yet, the prof gives more detail explanation with the help of videos and extra material ( not specified whether or not it will appear in mt or finals) so attend some haha esp. those after midterm
Lab is a separate part from the lecture content, learn more about data analytics and more practical stuff (require punctual attendance to have attendance point and complete the quiz in class!)
reviews.comment_teaching:
clear explanation, tho monotone, so a quite boring
tho she uses real-life e.g. to explain which helps a lot with memorising
reviews.comment_grading:
GOOD
midterm: 41.5/50 (mean:41.9)
Final: no grade released, tho I think I did quite well
Project: no grade released
there is random attendance checking
At last: A ><  (really happy)
I think final means a lot
reviews.comment_workload: Project has the heaviest workload, yet it's the only task, so sufficient time

reviews.author: 就黎升仙
reviews.comment_content:
E-commerce, social media... (let you know more about information system)
Lab (much useful than the lectures and practical)
reviews.comment_teaching:
She will just watch the notes and elaborate herself
It may be interesting sometimes
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
In-class exercise 5%
Lab 15%
Project 20%
Midterm 20%
Final 30%

Participation is just being active in class, going to the Industry Week (2%), attending Presentation Days (total 4 days, choose 2 days to come) (2%)
I think everyone is similar, you can get at least 4 marks in this part

In-class exercise: 3-4 times and professor will not tell you when to have mostly are Iprs and worksheets
I attend all lessons so I can ensure I can get full mark in this part
When your friends in other time slot have in-class exercise , it doesn't mean you will also have in-class exercise on the same day.

Lab is added up from 5% attendance and 5% canvas quiz after lab lessons and 5%during exam (total mark is 50marks)

Project (proposal, presentation and report)

Midterm (MC+short question)
mean is 43.5/50, SD is close to 2.5/50
and my mark is below mean

Final total mark is 30 marks (MC+calculation)

I got A-
Midterm and Final is not difficult if you really study hard
Grading is very good!
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload of the group project is not heavy because professor will guide you and have a long period of time to finish the work.

Midterm and Exam:
workload may be larger because it is very close to other courses' midterms and exams, so make sure you have a good time management

reviews.author: kiwifruit
reviews.title: if u like memorizing stuff, u will like him
reviews.comment_content: Although this course claims itself an introduction to IS, most of the content was not quite related to IS. To me, this course was more like introducing E-commerce and business model to us.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He was just reading aloud from the ppt and his voice was so flat that I almost slept in class. Also, he gave almost no guidance for our group project so basically we were lost and we just came up with sth that seemed make sense.

For the lab session, I never know what's going on for the business analytics and big data analytics parts. I just follow the TA's instruction but she talked so fast.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm and final were badly designed because he liked to ask for small details so even though u revised a lot u still don't know the correct answer.

Grading was quite good tbh, but he did not disclose the final exam mark and the project mark. Midterm got 8x/100 (mean was like 6x - 7x, couldn't remember correctly).

Finally got A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
The group project was useless and u need to come up with a new business related to IS with your groupmates. It takes time to discuss for the presentation and finish the report. Good teammates can save your life.

Need to attend lab sessions for participation marks and quiz.

Also, it takes time to memorize his ppt because his ppt was crowded with so many incoherent ideas.

reviews.author: daydream4ever
reviews.comment_content: The content basically covers various basic IT knowledge like big data and e-commerce. It feels like basically most of the stuff is about memorization. If you memorize all the stuff in the ppt, you get good grades. Lab is quite tricky but as long you study in details it should be fine
reviews.comment_teaching: Though the content is common sense, the prof manages to teach in an interesting way by using appropriate accents and examples. I enjoyed her teachings quite a lot
reviews.comment_grading: I got 1.5 SD above mean in the midterm, but I got a C+. So I guessed I must've shitted my finals and group projects (Marks not shown). But one thing to bear in mind is that the exams are usually so easy that everyone gets high marks. So even if you perform well in one particular exams it might not save you in case if you performed badly in other tasks.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 project presentation, proposal, final report, and lab quizzes during lab session. Midterm and finals are included. Not very heavy workload if you don't have free riders.

reviews.author: ming_ctm
reviews.title: 高質Prof
reviews.comment_content:
大路IS入門野(e.g. IoT, Big Data, etc...)
詳細內容可以參考翻其他review

有樣嘢好既就係 佢第一堂會問我地有d咩topics想學，之後根據我地想學既內容去微調個course
reviews.comment_teaching:
其實Tat Koon教得好好，會好比心機準備上堂d野，inspiring得黎又幾搞笑

成個 year 1 覺得教學上最有心最好就係佢

(聽講有好多隔離prof既人走左過黎sit佢堂 搞到要出notice叫佢哋去翻自己個prof堂到上堂lol)
reviews.comment_grading:
***Final 同Project report好重要***

Class Participation(20%):
淨係計 industrial talk & presentation period attendance
一開始講明左答問題個d都唔計(Heaven for introverts!!!)

Labs(15%):
attendance + lab quiz (unlimited attempts)
去齊曬就滿分

GroupProject(20%):
Presentation:

Report: 無出分

Midterm Exam(20%):
- Mean: 28.2/34 High: 33.5/34
(midterm佢話唔小心出得太難lol 所以全部人都加左分)

Final Exam(25%):
- (Lecture)Mean: 38/49 High: 49/49
- (Lab)Mean: 38.7/50 High: 50/50
reviews.comment_workload:
唔算多

得1個group project(Present + Report)
不過present可能要花下心思(整片/app prototype/ photoshop)
但其實present組組都差唔多分 所以自己衡量

reviews.author: Funggggg
reviews.comment_content:
Lectures
Lab every week
reviews.comment_teaching: very interesting lecture. I attend every lectures even though lecture videos were posted on canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
class participation 20%(5% industry week, 15% peer evaluation)
peer evaluations for other groups are really important. Other groups will rate your comments so make sure to write how good they are and some improvements.
Labs 15%( 5% attendance and 10% exam)
just attend every sessions and you will get 5%
Group project 20%( 10% business plan and 10% presentation)
Midterm 20% final 25%


I got 32.55/34 in midterm
43.5/49 in final
45/50 in lab exam( attend every lab)
9.1/10 in presentation (dont know the mark for business plan)
A grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy. only 1 midterm ,1 final and 1 group project.
just spend one or two days memorize all things from the ppt and you will get good grade.

reviews.author: kychancn
reviews.comment_content: As the course is just introduction course, it is quite easy to understand all concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture: He is a good teacher. He talked in an interesting and funny way.
Lab:
He follows the lab manual and you finish the task by following him or the manual.
But tbh no one care you finished the task or not.
Just be sure that you study and read all manual before final.
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is not that good.
Means are really high so you have to make sure that you have studied more that others. Otherwise, grade C+ is waiting you.
reviews.comment_workload: There are group project, labs, mid-term and final.

reviews.author: zzzz
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces a broad coverage of technology concepts trends and fundamental principles for the effective use of computer-based information system. Personally speaking, i think it provides us a general knowledge about the major of Information System.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Tat Koon speaks clearly and has a knowledge about current industry of Information System. He tries his best to make the boring content being more interesting, but sometimes he prefers to choose international student to answer his question.
reviews.comment_grading:
class participation 20%
labs 15%
Group project 20%
Midterm exam 20%
Final exam 25%
many students complains about the grading system, especially the part of group project.
i got
28.44/34 in midterm exam
45.77/49 in final exam
48/50 in lab final exam
9/10 in group project
only got B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload concentrates on the project and midterm + final exam. We spend most time on the group project and presentation, but it would be fine if you have good group members.

reviews.author: mavericks
reviews.comment_content:
The Lecture itself consists of :
1. Digital Economy
2. E-commerce
3. Online Platform
4. Social Media
5. Software&Hardware
6. Database (SQL) and Business Analytics
7. Big Data Analytics
8. Crowdsourcing

Lab:
- Web Analytics
- MS Access
- Analytics w/ Excel
- Advanced Business Analytics
- Big Data Analytics

Group Project :
Form any ideas and relate it to TK's teaching
reviews.comment_teaching: Tat Koon is a really nice teacher. He interacts quite a lot with his students and is always open for suggestions. He knows exactly how to teach student. His class is fun since he sometimes throws a joke with the students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Great, make sure that you guys score mean + SD on both midterm and final exam. As long as you guys are doing good during the group project, I think that it might lead for an A range score.

Class participation : 20% --> Group Project Review
Labs : 15%
Group Project : 20%
Mid Term : 20%
Final : 25%
reviews.comment_workload: Reasonable workload. This course includes a group project in which we are going to be formed into 1 group with random students. Personally I think the group project itself contributes quite a lot to the whole course  grading and make sure you are a good team player. Mid-term and Final-exam are not cumulative and the amount of materials to be tested is still reasonable.

reviews.author: Munich
reviews.comment_content: Content is mostly about how the internet facilitates and evolves business development. It includes different it stuff such as kinds of computer hacks, social media management. It also has an Application Development Project where year team are pitching the investors(prof and students) your app and start up idea.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her voice is soft and has an accent that is hard to hear. She basically reads through power points in a boring way. It is hard to focus on and understand. I don't like how she always hides information that appeared in class just to attract people to come to class, makes it hard to study afterwards. But one thing good about her is she respects students and listens to feedbacks. I can see her effort in trying to better the class quality and atmosphere by asking for opinions and making adjustments.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not that good.
The lab session is quite straightforward however the contents are not too difficult so the means are quite high. I was doing ok throughout the semester but fall really short on the final exam. So I ended up with a big fat C.
reviews.comment_workload: It is not that intense compared to other courses. Along with class participation, which is quite easily achievable, and lab marks, there are one midterm, one group project and one final exam. Weightings are quite even so its ok.

reviews.author: ducky
reviews.comment_content:
Basic IS-related stuff. Topics can be seen from previous reviews written by others:)
Contents are rather easy because you do not need to really understand how those things work to get a high mark. Just simply memorize all the powerpoint and notes jotted down from lectures can get a fair mark in both midterm and exam.  
I think they are useful because it really makes me learn more about IS and they are quite interesting (e.g. Google search engine and cyber attack)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sorry to say that but her teaching style is really bad. It is really hard to follow what she is saying and her English is horrible. She cannot answer some of the questions raised by students. Also, she simply giving the answer of MC-questions, but cannot clearly explain why other choices are wrong. So, there are many vacant seats in her lectures.
Despite her teaching style, she is really a nice person. She replies to emails from students quickly and very detailed. She always smiles when students ask her questions before and after the lecture. Also, she is willing to listen to students' comments and make some adjustments (posting lecture videos and speak louder in lectures).
reviews.comment_grading:
Not as good as others describe. I think it's just fair.
The final adp project mark is not disclosed, and it carries more than 20% of the grading! The transparency is low.
Also, there is no peer evaluation of the project, and some of my groupmates are free-riders. really sad:(
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is medium-high level. The whole adp project carried through the whole semester. Students need to hand in the financial report, presentation and final project. But if you have good groupmate, it is not a big deal.

reviews.author: vino
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy
E-Commerce
Cyber Security in E-Commerce
Online Platforms
Social Media Management
Software, Hardware and Network Technologies
Databases and Business Analytics
Big Data Analytics

Content is pretty general and straightforward. You can understand it simply by common sense. This course helps you to understand more word phrases used in the business world.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Yanzhen is a new prof. I could feel that she put a ton effort into improving her teaching, but I think a lot more work needed to be done. Her teaching style is script-reading the ppt but there are many blanks and unanswered questions in the slides.

Her fluency and accent is a problem when explaining new stuff to us. Luckily, she is quick at responding emails, so just hit her an email if you have anything unclear.

It is always risky to take courses by a new prof.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is lenient I think.

She is giving nearly full marks for every group's project, so the only thing determining your grade are midterm and final.

Midterm study guideline was clear enough but that's not the case for final.

Midterm mean: 78/100
Final (lecture) mean: 35/49
Final (lab) mean: 39/50
reviews.comment_workload:
The only workload is the ADP project. Workload varies a lot and depends on your groupmates.

Project Details:
Goal: Your company has decided to create an application (app). You need capital to create your app, so you are presenting a proposal to a Venture Capital (VC) firm. The proposal (in memo form, written in 3rd person) will include information about the app, the marketing plan, a high-level description of the market for your app, and solid reasoning for why you think your app will out-perform the competition.

reviews.author: Joey Ho
reviews.comment_content:
At the beginning of ISOM 2010, Tat-Koon asked the students to give some suggestions for the content of the course.
Tat Koon tried to include the things which were suggested by them, like the Internet of Things (loT).

Here are some big topics of this course.
1. Digital Economy
2. E-Commerce
3. Software & Hardware
4. Database & Analytics
5. Online Platforms
6. Social Media
7. Big Data
8. Crowdsourcing
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think his teaching is quite good.
- Interactive
- Tat-Koon tried to include some discussion to consolidate the ideas which had discussed in the lectures  
- include lecture videos
- He tried to improve himself after collecting the feedback after mid-term

But there are the lab tutorials. You may think that it may hard to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Class Participation 20%
(not depend on the contribution in class)  
- Labs 15%
- Group Project 20%
- Midterm Exam 20%
- Final Exam 25% (non-cumulative)

For your Reference:
Project Presentation(Mean: 9.2/10)
Final Exam (Mean: 38/49)
Lab Final Exam (Mean:38.7/50)
Midterm Exam (Mean:28.2/34)
reviews.comment_workload:
Actually, the workload is quite heavy but less than other ISOM courses, like ISOM 2700 and 2500.

The project is the most time-consuming. Not only because of the project presentation and the report, the feedback for each group is also one of the difficult parts. You need to give the feedback for the presenters at that day and the presenters will rate your feedback. Those rating may affect your participation marks. Therefore, you cannot write something only with 1 or 2 sentences.  Besides, you need to hand in 4 feedbacks within a day so it may hard to you if you have many lessons on that day.

What you need to do in the course:
Online quiz of each lab tutorial (attendance is a must)
Midterm Exam
Final Exam + Lab Final Exam
Reading Assignment #1 + #2
Project Report + Presentation
Attend the Industry Talk * 2

reviews.author: chloechm
reviews.comment_content:
The lecture is very easy to understand. It gives a simple introduction to business and IS. Mostly about sources of data and e-commerce.
But the LAB of ISOM 2010 is totally different from the lecture. Their contents are irrelevant and completely different. I think the LAB is more difficult than lecture. The LAB teaches some basic programming and data analysis.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecture is a little boring but very easy to understand. Printed notes distributed at the beginning of every lecture.
The tutor of the LAB is extremely boring but things are taught in a fast pace.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term: Below mean about 1 SD
Final: (i think i did quite well)
Project: good (every group got high marks)
Grade: A+
The LAB only consists of a small portion in final exam, but it requires punctual attendance to every LAB.
Xu Hong gives GOOD GRADES.
reviews.comment_workload:
No individual assignment.
Only group project (easy).
Lecture only takes 1-2 times attendance. (It is ok not to attend most lecture but can still get a good grade)

reviews.author: Sooooo
reviews.title: Nice guy I guess
reviews.comment_content:
Easy introduction course on Information Systems
Not much technical things but introducing some IS concepts as well as case study on companies applying Information Systems in their business
If you are interested in IS, the course would not be boring for you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a new professor in HKUST, well his teaching is fair I guess.
He merely read out the powerpoint so skipping lessons would not be a big deal
He sometimes make fun of the class for having only around 10 students (as it is a 9am class and no attendance taking lol)
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very good as you recite all ppt
his questions are MCQs and pretty straight forward
Class participation [10%]
Lab [15%]
Project [20%]
Midterm Exam [25%]
Final Exam [30%]
I got below mean around 1 sd in Midterm
18% for project (i guess everyone are almost same)
Above mean around 1 sd in Final
The final grade is B+
So I guess its grading is quite nice....
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload indeed
Just remember to attend his lessons before mid-term and final, he would give a revision session
And attend lessons to watch all presentation from the groups as he only take attendance for those 3 lessons

Besides, there are 2 compulsory talks to attend, but in return, no lessons for that week for ISOM2010 :)

For the project, not much workload, he just require us to submit the progress report, presentation and a final report
Depends on whether u want good grade or not, we consulted him for advice and he gave good comments for us to improve so our project mark was quite satisfactory. Those who did not ask for his advice and did not pick a good theme may not get very good mark for the project..

reviews.author: Denis
reviews.title: Very nice course
reviews.comment_content: A fundamental course for business students to have a brief insight for information system. The content is quite basic yet intriguing. The content mainly covers latest trends and technology such as social media, blockchain and so on so on.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xu Hong is a nice lecturer who is willing to answer any question during and after lectures. She is a friendly professor. Top 3 lecturers in university according to my own experience.
reviews.comment_grading: Nice grading. The grading of this subject mainly consists of 3 parts, two exams and the group project. The exams are quite easy in my opinion, therefore, the group project will be the difference maker.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload of this course isn't very low yet students still have to put effort in the course in order to achieve high results. Moreover, there aren't many assignments throughout the semester other than the project.

reviews.author: chloenhw
reviews.comment_content:
LAB and LECTURE are separated
lecture:
no calculations at all
memorization of concepts
content isnt very difficult (u can understand it reading the lecture slides on ur own)
lab:
takes attendance (quite strictly so u better attend that class urself)
very easy in the beginning but gets so confusing after midterm, if u miss one step, u cant do anything else
reviews.comment_teaching:
new korean prof
has a rather strong korean accent
basically reads from ppt so not a lot of people go to his class (especially when its a 9am class)
he is not quite sure about the syllabus, grading and projects
not much guidelines on project (better ask the TA or ask him after class)
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is fair
15% from LAB (attendance and some lab questions in final exam)
from lecture: project + midterm + final
reviews.comment_workload: lecture: no attendance, one group project (proposal + presentation + report), midterm, final exam (with MC and short questions and long questions)

reviews.author: yujasminemanyee
reviews.comment_content: the content is easy to understand and quite a lot of it are common sense but because of ppl can get high marks easily and the mean is often very high
reviews.comment_teaching: professor is willing to give comment to project and will give comment right after the presentation
reviews.comment_grading: the mean is quite high which make getting good grade even harder
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable workload no regular assignments but the project takes up a large portion of the overall grade
midterm and final exam are quite easy but there's short questions which require some reciting

reviews.author: ysfchan
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content is easy to be understood because they are mostly lively cases.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is quite boring that most of the time is like reading aloud the lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading: The midterm and and final are in similar format that are MCs and fill in the blanks only. If you memorize the lecture notes well, you can then get good grade easily.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. There is no assignment but only the group project and presentation. All you need to hand in is the self-introduction card , the project's proposal, final project as well as the powerpoint.

reviews.author: hibye01
reviews.title: below mean in mid-term but get A+!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
The course provides fundamentals of Information system, namely the different concepts that describe the business model and operating systems in the IT industry. There are both lectures and lab sections, former could be skipped but make sure that you have all the notes and case studies. Students must attend lab sections to take participation score.
There will be around 10 labs and you must complete the quiz at the end of each section. Unlimited attempts are allowed. Students who have taken Comp1022Q will surely have benefits since Excel VBA is included in lab syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: The content is simple and easy to understand. Xu Hong's teaching style is just following the slides and speak out its content. Honestly, you can just skip all the lessons if you do not care about the participation marks. She will have a review session before mid-term and final. Simply memorize all the content in the review session the is ok.
reviews.comment_grading:
every time mean is very high becoz of simple content
-need be very careful and try to find out the trap Prof has set

Midterm:41.5/50
mean: 43.3/50

Project proposal: 10/10
mean: 9.5/10

Final: no score announced
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is not heavy
Only one project , one midterm and final

You do not need to prepare anythings for the lectures
or can even skip the lesson if you want

You can choose the groupmate by yourselves, so please make a wise choice

reviews.author: 好想cga過3嘅人士
reviews.title: 大愛Xu Hong BB<3
reviews.comment_content:

-冇code要打

reviews.comment_teaching:

-Li Guangrui嘅英文我認真唔中意，上lab佢只係識得叫人跟住lab menu...但其實份人都好嘅，純粹教法唔太掂
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 47/50 Mean= 43.3 SD unknown
Final 冇出分 Project都冇

A+......

我收到個刻都呆左，本學渣開心到暈

reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.author: shy
reviews.title: A quite general introduction course
reviews.comment_content:
It is a general introduction course so it covers only some basic concepts and theories that are not so practical and technical.
From my memory, the topics include E-commerce, digital economy, online platforms, data analytics, big data, bitcoins & blockchain. I personally find the topics about big data and blockchain more interesting than others.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Dongwon Lee is basically reading the powerpoints out every lesson, so his lessons are extremely boring that everyone is not concentrating in class but doing their own stuff instead. Even if he includes real-life cases, he is still reading them aloud lol So actually you don't even need to attend his lectures and can self-study his powerpoint slides, which are though made nice and clear. And he doesn't give any instructions regarding the project or provide any expectations.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got 1 SD higher than the mean in midterm.
slightly over mean in final exam.
Report over mean.
And I get a B+
Fair enough though
reviews.comment_workload:
I personally think the workload is not heavy, the only workload is the final report and presentation. But because he doesn't really provide explicit instructions it is quite difficult to handle though.
At the beginning of the semester, he said that he will take attendance randomly during the class. But it turns out that he only took attendance 2-3 times during the presentation classes and it is announced beforehand.

reviews.author: Marcoksc
reviews.comment_content:
The course provides fundamentals of Information system, namely the different concepts that describe the business model and operating systems in the IT industry. There are both lectures and lab sections, former could be skipped but make sure that you have all the notes and case studies. Students must attend lab sections to take participation score.
There will be around 10 labs and you must complete the quiz at the end of each section. Unlimited attempts are allowed. Students who have taken Comp1022Q will surely have benefits since Excel VBA is included in lab syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pace is acceptable and generally slower than the average courses in HKUST.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm and Final
Project (1st draft , presentation and final paper)

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content:
呢個course嘅內容主要分做fundamentals
同埋current trend兩個部份
例如話online platform
business analytics同埋大數據等等
整體嚟講用common sense就理解到
但係就係因為太直接 啲細微位喺考試就係攞分關鍵

Lab主要就住lecture嘅內容教啲technical skills
同時都係實踐返lecture入面啲理論嘢
reviews.comment_teaching:
新prof 教書非常悶
好間唔中先會問一兩條問題同人interact
大部份堂又唔點名同無in-class activities
midterm過後得返一半人上堂
另外project指示非常唔清晰
下下要走上佢房問佢應該點做
但係問完都好似無問到要向咩方向諗咁樣... -_-

Lab TA 就教得還好 逐步逐步教你做task

reviews.comment_grading:
正常
Class participation 10%
- presentation attendance
- industry week talk attendance
- canvas discussion (近乎無人做過)
所以都唔係好知點比分

Project 20%
- Presentation 7/8 (Mean: 6.6)
- Report 7/8 (Mean: 7.2)

44/50  Mean: 41.56 SD: 5.57
Final 30%
36/60  Mean: 39.3

reviews.author: supersherlockxd
reviews.title: The course is shite
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture: Honestly I have no idea what I learnt after the end of the semester either... mainly about the different application of IS in different aspects, such as accounting, commerce, etc.

Lab: Teaching stuff like excel, app development, and lots of big data and excel VBA. Not as hardcore as computer courses though I suppose.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture: total BS, he doesn't know what he is talking about either, repeat and repeat
Lab: Uncle Paul is actually quite good (and funny at times though everyone just wants to leave his lab asap...) :p
reviews.comment_grading:
Rumor has it: you have to brown-nose him a lot before getting a good grade. As a result me and my friend had to skype him at 2 am in the morning before the midterm in order for him to remember who we are. It worked wonders (my friend was finally recognised after the skype session)

Got a B overall, considering I didn't revise for the finals it's okay given I had brown-nosed him a lot in the beginning of the semester (and didn't bother to continue brown-nosing him anymore later on lol).

He will provide "study guide" which are just questions but once you recite the answers for the questions it's easy to get full marks.

(p.s. please gently remind him to upload documents online if he had not, he actually half-scolded me for something he did wrong... and as such we only got the midterm review a day before the midterm)
reviews.comment_workload:
Light (sort of)

If you work on the presentation seriously it's hard not to devote a lot of time in it. But our group just hea did the project due to the appearance of a "groupmate" that pretends to contribute a lot but is actually a freerider :o)

reviews.author: NONAMEGUY
reviews.title: nice grade overall
reviews.comment_content:
A basic look into information systems theories, quite useful for future case comps... It's not very technical and practical, baically telling you what those theory are.

e.g, the types of online platform, what is their audience, how do they earn money, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching is quite fun.
He used a lot of vivid examples and I never fell asleep in his class LOL.
reviews.comment_grading:
I must say...the grading is good and is heavily based on the performance of gorup project and per evaluation.

But you must do well in the midterm and final!
I am both 1sd below mean in midterm and final, gorup presentation mean...Ended up a B- T^T

well I deserve the B- and should be grateful that it was not a C range. But I must say that if you are not good at remember things and theories, you better go to other classes. I tried to remember all the things but still did so poorly in the exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload except the group project.
No attendance is taken so many of my friends dont attend classes.
Find reliable groupmates and it would be helpful!

reviews.author: ac6
reviews.comment_content: Theories and models about internet and business. Its quite interesting and easy to understand. Many facts and concepts are just common sense and similar with other business courses. The facts and names are not hard to recite as they are quite applicable in daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is probably the best that ive met. Teach with passion and heart <3. He tried to explain every concept clearly and always eager to receive feedback from students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite lenient.
Exams are not that hard if you really read thru the powerpoints and apply the knowledge in ur essays/long questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
no attendence, no iprs, no homework.

One Project with presentation is needed.
However, you cannot choose your own groupmate.
so the workload actually depends on your groupmates.

reviews.author: FEBE
reviews.comment_content: The contents are very useful and interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches very well, he made IS way more interesting than I'd ever thought. The professor is also very friendly towards the students. The class was always interactive due to the two-way communication between the professor and the students.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. In both mid-term and final exam, The professor would ask questions on how we could apply what he taught in real-life problems.
I guess you could be on the A range as long as you actively participate in class and in the group project.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is at the right level. Only one group project throughout the semester, one mid-term and final exam.
