reviews.author: dicksonyu26
reviews.comment_content: Course content are different as for different professors. For Dr. P, he covers a brief introduction of E Commerce, Big Data and different aspects that Information system are involved in business world, including IS & Marketing, IS & Accounting, IS & Sustainability, e.t.c. Contents are very easy and basic. It grants students chances to have a look at what Information System is in fact. To me personally, it is an eye-opening experience as I really understand more about Information System and I am attracted by the course that I am going to go for this major.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. P stresses on class atmosphere and interaction of students and teachers. He played many interesting IS-related videos and allowed students to discuss among some open-ended topics. Discussion occupies quite a large portion of the lecture period. His teaching is systematic, interesting and inspiring.
reviews.comment_grading: Since course materials are quite easy, it is relatively difficult to get good grades even if we did a great job in final and projects. One mark matters a lot in ISOM 2010. You have to engage more in lesson so that he can recognise you and remember your name and score higher for participation.
reviews.comment_workload: Small workload, only a short project to hand in and present at the end of the course plus two midterms and a final. Only very few things have to be revised and memorised. His midterms and final are like dictation.

reviews.title: I wish I swapped out
reviews.comment_content: I honestly don't even know what I learned
reviews.comment_teaching: Where do I begin.. He spends more time showing you a 5 min video and leaving the room for 10 and coming back to discuss the same thing for a solid 20 minutes. He then puts on a ppt with the same material on it and slowly reads them out and BS for a bit longer hoping class ends
reviews.comment_grading:
Rumor has it that you have to go hiking with him for him to remember his name. You won't find out the grade for your project, which supposedly takes up a big portion of your grade.

Attendance wise you have to make sure you're heard each time in class. He takes mental attendance or something. There was once a few kids didn't come to class and he started listing out the people he knows is not there. Creepy.
reviews.comment_workload: There's two exams (midterm and finals) and a project. Honestly depends on how much work you want to put in.

reviews.author: Tornado
reviews.title: Nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
I like how he actually teaches us IS concepts, for an introductory course, it is more than enough

Attendance only counts for you to watch the others when they present

(Oh, we have lab)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I like how he actually uses point forms to present his lecture.

He also let us watch videos to help us learn
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is nice, as long as you study, you can get B+ or above
reviews.comment_workload:
Dude, we have a group project and a presentation to do, you believe that this part would score high?

Anyways, the workload is not large, at least you don't have homework

reviews.author: klaw
reviews.title: free A and A+ if your good at kissing ass
reviews.comment_content:
Course content is all BS
No meaningful information acquired that you can use in real life
Full of useless theories and phrases
Mostly common sense
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching style is very boring, basically you just sit for 1 hour and 20 minutes listening to him lecturing about nothing. You are not allowed play your phone in class. Lecture about the materials can be done in 20 minutes, but he keeps dragging it with class discussions. I have to keep drinking water to keep myself awake.

The class discussions doesn't help with understanding the material at all. Basically people just ask shitty questions to get participation points and nobody really listens to his equally shitty answer. The class discussions are usually half an hour long and the rest of the lecture duration are allocated for watching 1-2 20 minute youtube video and another class sharing about our opinions regarding the video.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 78/80
Group project and Final exam are not disclosed.
I'm pretty sure I flunked the final exam though as I didn't fill out half of the lab exam.
Letter grade: A

You have to keep participating in events (such as hiking) and in class (I participated once every class) to get on his good side. You also have to go to for an office appointment every now and then.

He gives good grades to students that he's close with and bad grades to the ones he doesn't remember.
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload at all except for the group presentation which you will have more than enough time to work on.
No attendance, but he knows which student came to the lecture or not.
Exams are relatively easy, you just have to memorize all of his slides and write down everything in the exam. Lab exam are easy as well, they gave you cheat sheet, so you just have to make sure you did all the questions.

reviews.author: Haha
reviews.comment_content: Interesting content, current trend of technology and its utilisation. Most knowledge taught in the class is about common sense and basic knowledge of current technology development
reviews.comment_teaching: chill and interesting, video is included, talking about different utilisation of technology. What he said in the class will be included the exam and may not written down in the lecture slide
reviews.comment_grading:
attendance by participating some class activities which are quite interesting
mid term and the final examination will include MC and short question.
reviews.comment_workload: Light, only 1 mid term, 1 final, 1 project, Labs and attendance

reviews.author: Jellobeano
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to Information Systems is very interesting. It is also very easy to follow as most of the things in the course are basic knowledge and common sense.
reviews.comment_teaching: XU Hong only teaches stuff that will be included in the examinations, which is nice as you know what to study for the mid terms and finals. Sometimes she will spend time talking on cases (optional), however, one or two questions will be relevant to the answers discussed in class in mid term.
reviews.comment_grading:
You need to get all attendance scores, do not miss lessons nor labs if you want to get a good grade in this course, every percent is crucial as everyone gets a very high mark in all grading elements.

The mid terms and finals included both MC and short questions. Do not worry about the short questions, they are very easy as long as you have read the power point once.

As mentioned above, the content is easy, therefore everyone scored very high. One or two questions did wrong will make you equal or even below mean.

I above mean 2 SD in midterms. Project got a mean. Final above mean. Total 87% and eventually score a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Attendance, Labs, Projects, Midterm, Finals.

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Quite straightforward, and interesting.
reviews.comment_content: The content itself is pretty straightforward - digital economy, e-commerce, big data, business analytics. There's no textbook, and all the required information is found on the lecture slides, which are pretty detailed and easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Zhang is a really interactive and interesting teacher, and you learn a lot from him - both about the content and about wider issues in class. He's very helpful and it's very easy to approach him with any questions you have with the course content, group project and anything else. I would highly recommending enrolling in his section because his lessons are very interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is pretty decent. There's a group project, attendance (randomly counted), midterm and final. Be warned though, the mean for the midterm and final is really high because the exams themselves are quite simple (for example, the mean for the midterm was 85/100 with SD 6.5 or so). So, taking that into respect, it's not THAT easy to get A range. That said, Professor Zhang tries to give as many students grades in the A range, so your hard work should be reflected in your grade.

In addition, there are also weekly tutorials and the content covered in the later lab sessions is assessed in a lab paper that is given during the final exam session. Lab session attendance and lab paper grades counts for 15% of the total grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is extremely light. As you are allowed to form your own group for the project, it is pretty flexible and if you are teamed up with hard workers, the project isn't too difficult to complete (but it is important that your idea is unique/innovative if you are doing the app). Other than that, attending all the lectures should be sufficient and in case you're not able to attend any of them, all of the lectures are videotaped and posted on Canvas incase you want to watch them again for review.

reviews.author: abcde
reviews.title: Good Luck if you are in Dr P's class
reviews.comment_content: The content taught during lecture is very common sense. It focuses on how IT connects people in the world and achieves sustainability. Some concepts related to IS auditing are also covered.
reviews.comment_teaching: The worst professor I have ever seen in my life. His logic and powerpoint slides are hard to follow. He spent so much time on group discussions and did not teach much. You need to answer his questions during his lecture so that he can remember your face.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bad grade.

He organised many time-wasting "out-of-class activities" like "Hang out in Hang Hau" (walking from HKUST to Hang Hau) and you need to participate in these activities to score a high participation mark.

He didn't give clear instructions on the group project and presentations. It was very hard to figure out what he actually wants.

The mean of midterm and final is extremely high. If you mess up one of the exams, you are likely to get a very bad grade. The questions were basically testing your memory. Recite every single word of the slide, then you can get full marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload. You need to spend a lot of time to prepare for the project by consulting him.

reviews.author: hlhkwok
reviews.comment_content: Content was easy and common sense. Covered topics like E-commerce, Big Data, and something more.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was nice and witty. Love his lectures. As he didn't stress on studying for finals and midterm that much so the papers were really simply (hence a very high mean). He kept emphasising that this course was about training you how to think instead of the muscle-building-nature like other courses.
reviews.comment_grading: Attendance, presentation, group project, Midterm and Finals (MCs and really easy short questions)  and Lab
reviews.comment_workload: Have to work on group project. But not much studying to do, just study the lecture powerpoint slides and focus more on the review session.

reviews.author: Ronnie
reviews.title: Awesome Course
reviews.comment_content: It is pretty shit. Saying some primary level terms. and show a lot of examples. keep talking about IBM. It is useful when the bonus at final is testing it. You dont really have to listen to anything he teaches. Everything is on the slides. Do revision before final.
reviews.comment_teaching: It likes to ask question and make jokes that he laughs. It has an awesome way of entertaining himself. It is fun tho sometimes look at his cute face. He doesnt mind you do anything. People are watching youtube with earphones. But dont skip lesson. He is cunning as hell. Taking attendance super random, but will fail you if you miss it 3 / 5 times.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolutely perfect. Above one sd in final. And project mark unknown, probably mean. I guess it is pretty awesome, when i got a B+ at last. The final s mean is pretty high. Because it is way too easy.
reviews.comment_workload:
It is reli low. only a dumb final and a presentation on new technology.
Random grouping but then, you got to ask him a lot about what he likes.

reviews.author: da zi
reviews.comment_content:
E-commerce, Web2.0, Big Data etc Basic concepts of IS.

Very easy, can study very well without ICT/IT background.

1 midterm, Final Exam, 1 Group project, In-class Exercises that are very easy and only have around five.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xu, hong is a nice professor and she would not ask difficult questions. Her teaching is clear and the speed is moderate but maybe a bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Although there is 10%in participation, as it was a 9am class, only 2-3 people answered her question, and there was no parti card, so I think she gave each student equal marks in participation part.

The project was counted around 30%, but everyone gets similar grade if you did not too bad.

The examination is all about the content on the notes. Simply recite all of them and attend lesson (as some answer are all given in class)can get an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
No Homework.
The biggest workload comes from the project. But actually, each student just need to contribute little effort because there are 6 ppl in a group and you can freely choose your groupmate.

reviews.author: TC
reviews.title: Thank you soooo much Michael!
reviews.comment_content:
Both lectures and lab sessions are required.
Lecture:The content is quite easy to catch up and follow.
Basically just some fundamental knowledge regarding computer. Some topics are quite interesting like social networking, auction etc.
Lab session: 10 lessons in total, only content from last 5 lessons will be examined which are VBA and big data
reviews.comment_teaching:
Michael always play videos and share his personal lifes with us, they are quite attracting and interesting. He spoke very clearly, and explained the concepts in a manner that was easy to understand. During the lecture before a quiz, he would highlight all the keypoints and information that may appear on the quiz.

Sum Yu always response email efficiently. His teaching is clear and in a detailed manner. And he is willing to answer your questions related to IS industry.
reviews.comment_grading:
Extremely gooooood grading, thx Michael!
Weighting:
Midterm: 20%
Final Exam: 30%
Participation:
-Passive (in-class activity): 5%
-Active (either answer question during lectures or sending links to him):10%
Project: 20%
Lab:
-attendance: 5%
-exam paper: 10%

Mean is high and S.D. is low for this course, it is because the content is so easy for everyone.
So what you need to do is to avoid careless mistakes!
Those participation score you should get full mark for sure.
Take myself as an example,
My mid-term = below mean ~ 1.5 s.d
Participation (both passive and active) = full mark
Other score = unknown, as he did not disclose the score
Overall score = 86 (from canvas, mean = 83.x; max. = 100; min = 59)
which means I just slightly above mean for the whole course, but I still able to get a B+!!!
Very Very Very good grade!
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light:
-One group project
-One mid-term test
-One exam (with both lecture content and lab content)
Basically the second half lectures you need not attend, as most/all of the passive participation mark activities are conducted in the first half lectures, and there are lecture videos provided for this course. So you can simply watch the videos yourself starting from November.

reviews.author: htliab
reviews.comment_content:
lecture:
basic, elementary content of information system
content eg: online shopping, big data analytic etc
rich content and many real-life examples
not difficult to understand

lab:
quite difficult and clumsy
sometimes is hard to understand
but exam will provide data sheet, so no worries
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture:
教法比較傳統
不過清晰易明
基本上上堂專心聽就會明

lab:
TA講得有d快
有時幾難follow
reviews.comment_grading:
okay不錯
midterm過一個sd
project過sd
full parti mark
final 踩mean
overall：B+
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is not heavy
participation point,industry talks,project,midterm&final
the most heaviest : project
It depends on your group mates
if they re responsible, u dun have much workload.

reviews.author: Kikiwithcat
reviews.title: Great Course for HKDSE ICT students
reviews.comment_content: Quite useful for students who are interested in IT technologies.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Michael will skip useless or boring part of the class and focus on interesting topics. Videos are used to enrich our understanding on certain topics such as artificial intelligence.

Samuel is a good TA. He responses quickly to emails from students and he also glad to answer questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Remember to attend every class as Michael loves sudden attendance bonus. (You attend the class that day and you will receive extra bonus point! Just that easy~)

I attended all the classes and actively participated in classroom discussion. I complete all the requirements and I got 100% at last. My final grading is A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just a group project with presentation and a final written report.
No homework or other assignment.
Sometimes we need to attend career talks but those are also inspiring.

reviews.author: rexng
reviews.comment_content: The content is too simple for an university student. Most of them are easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style from Michael is so good. He doesn't focus on memorizing, instead, emphasizes on what you can exactly be benefited from the class. However, michael plays lots of videos during lesson and you may probably find it boring.
reviews.comment_grading: To be honest, i think Michael probably gives the best grade among all professors. Once he said during class, he gives 30% of students A range and half of them would be A+. It turns out my grade is above my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is extremely low, what you have to need is only one mid-term, one group project with presentation and one non-cumulative final.
all of the examinations are simple and straightforward. Strongly recommend you not to spend too much time on it if you enrolled into Michael's class.

reviews.author: Bell
reviews.comment_content: This course mostly consists of basic background information of the e-commerce world. Simple calculation(just a little bit). and little bit coding.
reviews.comment_teaching: My teacher is Professor Micheal Zhang. He is so cute :)))) Nice teacher always share a lot
reviews.comment_grading: Definitely good. Professor Zhang gives as much A range as he can. I got only 88% overall only but still got an A-.
reviews.comment_workload: light workload at all. Only one midterm one final and one project. The midterm and final are so easy as you dont need to memorise so many stuff. They are just MC.

reviews.author: Godblessyou
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content: Basically simple introduction of ISOM. E-commerce, Big data, something like that, nothing hard. You just have to recite the stuff on the powerpoint and can do well in the exams. The exams are in MCQ so the mean was quite high. Every point matters! The lab exam was very easy, you don't actually have to study for it, you can get the ans from the sth like cheat sheet provided.
reviews.comment_teaching: She read content from the slides, pretty boring though. I guess most students weren't listening. Remember to do all the in class exercise cause they matter when everyone's scores were close.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good.
Mid term: a few score above mean
Final: 87/100 (above mean)+ unknown score for lab part
reviews.comment_workload: Light, the project was the only assignment. Not hard to do well in project but you have to spend quite a lot of time on it. The content that has to be study for exams are few, you can spend a day to study the day before exam and do quite well if you participated most lessons.

reviews.author: Stephanie Lam
reviews.comment_content: The structure of what the professor wants to teach is very clear. Concepts that are related to IS are very basic, it feels more like a marketing course for most of the time.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite interesting, managed to stay awake even though had her lecture in the morning.
reviews.comment_grading: Participation accounts for final grading, but the professor never gives out participation card. The mean for midterm, project written report and presentation is quite high. The weightings for each assessment are quite balanced.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 3 in-class exercises (complete 3 surveys), 1 midterm exam, 1 project (written report + presentation) and 1 final exam (non-cumulative).

reviews.author: yy123
reviews.comment_content: It will be simply a fundamental course for Information Systems (IS), because if you wish to pursue a major in IS, the contents in ISOM 2010 is not really on the topic. It's somehow related to marketing, but quite interesting after all!
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teacher and being nice! She gave out candies in the last lesson for thanksgiving haha! It won't be too boring for her lessons anyway!
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. It depends on your efforts indeed, quite a lot to memorize if you wish to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: One project throughout the semester. Self-grouping.

reviews.author: Anmol
reviews.comment_content:
The content is completely different from other classes and if I dare say so the most interesting. It is also very relevant to us as individuals in this generation, no matter what stream you go to. If you want to know exactly what he covers, I have attached the syllabus! The mid-term and final are non-cumulative and relatively easy.

However, we are also given a LAB paper (just started recently), its not too hard but you should do well in it to get a good overall mark.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He usually plays interesting Tedx or other videos relating to thought-provoking concepts or technologies. This is generally interesting.

He also maintains a very interactive class which is good so you don't get bored easily and have a chance to contribute your opinions in the lecture.

He gives review sessions before midterm and final exams. Plus gives us numerous hints about the exam (basically indirectly tells you the exam question) so it's pretty chill.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very lenient, they try to give out as many A(s) as possible. But at the same time because the content and exams are so easy, many people score high which means you have to do good overall to get a A range. Overall, I got 90.5% (B+) and 92% was(A-).

You should try to receive all participation points because it really helps plus is eays.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework so very light workload.

Sometimes you have to do questions in class but then again its not much.

reviews.author: MC
reviews.title: The best course ever
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy
1. Explain data, information, and information systems.
2. Know the meaning of Moore’s law, Metcalf’s law and their implications.
3. Understand the implications of globalization.
4. Discuss the use of information systems in organizations.
5. Describe the newer aspects of working in the digital world.
6. Define ethics and describe the major ethical problems posed by the digital world.
Ecommerce
1. Describe the nature of e-business.
2. Define the e-business value chain and disintermediation.
3. Describe the basic e-business models.
4. Examine the major online marketing methods.
5. Discuss the major issues that are created by and affect e-business.
Social Media
1. Describe the key component of social media.
2. Explain the 3 features of social media authoring.
3. Understand the meaning of Tagging.
4. Explain the differences between traditional and social media.
Technical Foundations
1. Identify the major components of hardware and networking technology.
2. Identify the different types of software.
3. Describe the process in software development.
4. Discuss the trends in hardware and software, and the implications to businesses.
Big Data
3
1. Explain how organizations use data and information.
2. Explain the basic concepts of data management (data creation, sharing, mining, reporting).
3. Define database management systems (DBMS) and describe their various functions.
4. Data storage within and across organizations.
5. Explain how the relational database model works.
6. Describe how databases are developed.
7. Explain how organizations can use data warehousing and data mining for decision making.
8. Describe advanced database models and when their use is appropriate.
Business Analytics and Decision Makings
1. Discuss the problems associated with management decision-making.
2. Explain the specific information needs of managers in different functional areas of an organization, including production, operations, marketing and sales, accounting, human resources and IT.
3. Explain the decision-making process.
4. Explain the increasing roles and responsibilities of business managers as user and owner of data and the corporate information system.
5. Describe decision support systems.
6. Describe the opportunities and threats to corporate information system including capabilities in data treatment and analysis, data integrity, system security and issues in access restriction, and business contingency/continuity.
7. Discuss the roles and trend of IT in business analytics and decision making
Business, Accounting and Finance
1. Formulate appropriate information systems strategies to support implementation of business and functional strategies.
2. Use the system development life cycle to plan, design, implement, and evaluate an IT system.
3. Describe the application of information technology to various business fields including marketing, accounting, finance, strategic management and operations management.
4. Demonstrate an understanding of the behavioral issues of implementing information systems in organizations.
5. Describe how change management can contribute to successful implementation of information systems.
Technology-Enabled Business Trends
1. Identify major tech-enabled trends in near future
2. Examine impact of tech-enabled trends on individuals, firms, and society
3. Discuss business opportunities of new technologies
reviews.comment_teaching:
He always plays videos during class
He will later mentions the main points of the videos

He will give review session before midterm and final
During review sessions, he will give many hints about the midterm and final, he just tells you the exam questions indirectly lol

you just need to study the review ppt for the midterm and final
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm
20%
Final Exam:
30%
Participation
Passive:
5%
Active:
10%
Project:
20%
Lab:
15%

It is very easy to get all 15% participation points, remember to get them all

He will give 20% A range, sometimes he  will give more than 20% A range and need to write justification to the department for that  and half of the A range are A+

He only released the result of midterm
No result of report and presentation was released
overall mean 83.4 max100 min 59
grading : 89 (A-)
reviews.comment_workload: very light

reviews.author: Roddie
reviews.title: Studied for one sem but have no idea what is going on
reviews.comment_content:
The characteristic of Internet, some knowledge about E-commerce and social media and stuff.
Most of them are quite common sense but pay attention to those definitions and understand it thoroughly instead of memorizing it, coz you will be asked to list some examples or explain the phenomenon.
In the lab, ethical hacking, VBA, Macro Recording and stuff, you can finish it as long as you follow the step provided in the pdf. In the examination, a cheatsheet will be provided by the prof.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xu Hong is absolutely a great teacher and she always asks questions to let us participate (my class is relatively not active, probably because it is 9 am class ). She always tells her own experience while teaching, and it enabled us a more in-depth understanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is absolutely great.
20% midterm
30% final
15% lab
5% in-class quiz (which is just a questionnaire to take attendance, generally not academically related)
20% group project
10% in-class participation
The midterm is too easy to differentiate, full mark is 50 while the mean is 42.7, I screwed it and got 44 only. The SD is 3.something.
The final mark is not released.
Our presentation is quite good while the final report is just okay.
But I got A eventually, I think it probably because I am quite active and answer the questions asked by prof. So, in-class participation is very important.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload depends on how many effort you would like to put in. If only for the contents to be tested in the examination, the workload is very small.
For the group project, the more you put your effort on, the better result will be generated.

reviews.author: noname0.0
reviews.title: Strongly Recommend Xu Hong (get a A even mid term mean only)
reviews.comment_content: Quite nice teacher, willing to chat with students about the lecture after class. Just normal and basic IS things. Mid term and final are non cumulative , so good ^ ^
reviews.comment_teaching:
Actually  you should not expected to learn so many things from isom 2010 as it is only a fundamental course. Recite all the ppt so you would be ok for the exam.

There are a single lecture for you to review the midterm/ final material before exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super super good!!!

My mid term is mean only, but with a good project performance and final exam, i got A~~~ (even i fail in the lab part that make me loss 1.5% of the total grade)
reviews.comment_workload: very low workload, but be careful when you select your group mate.

reviews.author: dch
reviews.comment_content:
The class materials mainly covers E-commerce, Big data, and Digitalization. Lecture slides are very simple and straight-forward. There are going to be some videos shown during the class. They are all interesting and some of the exam questions are actually from the videos so you should jot-down the main points.

Lab is basically learning how to use some of the programs to do ethical hacking, simple vba and so on. Was fun but felt quite useless.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has amazing. He has diverse experiences in the business fields so he is very insightful.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not out yet so I am not sure how my grade is going to be but my friends who have taken the class previously shared that his grading is pretty good.

Lab attendance- 15%
Project-20% (group project with report and presentation)
Participation- passive- 5%
                      active-10%
Mid-term-20%
Final-30%

Mid term and Final are fairly easy if you reviewed the lecture slides and understand what each slides are about.
reviews.comment_workload:
There will be lecture videos uploaded after every class so you can skip the class. But if there are sometimes in-class exercises and, you will lose 5% of active participation points if you skipped these classes. 10% passive can be earned through answering questions during the class, or share class-relevant articles or videos to the TA. If you miss 10% this then you are literally an idiot.

Seems a lot of workload but this course was the one of the lightest workload course that i have taken so far.

reviews.author: Wes
reviews.title: BEST INSTRUCTOR EVER PERHAPS
reviews.comment_content: well to me it is actually a bit too much. Though it is an introduction course, they cover many topics, so which means that they would not talk about each topic thoroughly. Therefore you may have to memorize many terms or impacts without really understanding them.
reviews.comment_teaching: perhaps Tat Koon is the best instructor I have ever seen. No attendance taken. Never pick someone to answer his questions (unless he is familiar with you). Always illustrate the idea in a funny way.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good. He won't grade your class participation, so even though I never responded to him I still got a good grade. As long as you really did a good job in giving comments to other group works, nice exam result and good in peer evaluation, an A range is a must
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment. One midterm and one final. A group work. Need to attend all the sessions when other groups are presenting their work, and give comment to them. Comments would be graded by the groups you are commenting on, so be sure not to be too harsh even though their work is bullshit.

reviews.author: YSY
reviews.comment_content:
lol
I forgot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For Dr. P:
I don't know what I have learned in this course. Perhaps this prof is not suitable to me.
He has good memory so he can remember whether you have attend the lectures @@
He is willing to answer your questions but you may unable to understand the explanations again.



For TA(lab only):
Unacceptable!!!
No good at explanation. Poor at preparation. It seems to me that the TA didn't know what to teach. He often got lost in the class and needed us to give him some time to read the notes so that he could teach us. But it should be done before the class. He was not passionate to teach. The teaching were too boring even though some of the topics were fun.
But if you are not aim at learning something but just get the labs points, he is good because he is lenient.

He is willing to answer your questions but useless to me.
reviews.comment_grading:
Presentation 15%:
     don't know, but we feel good
Labs 15%:
     15/15 (most ppl got full mark, very simple exercises)
Mid-term 30%:
     70/80, a little bit below mean
Final 30%:
     don't know but maybe got mean

Participation (affect your grade?): Have you attend lectures? raise questions or answer questions? These may affect how prof think of you and your grade.
     I have attended all the lectures and the prof could recognize me.

grade = B
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively light. But you need to have good memory to recite all the things that you don't understand for the exams@@
And the marking of the exams was very vague. It seems to me that the TA gave me the score based on "feeling".

reviews.author: ivan9588
reviews.comment_content: As this is only an introduction course of Information System, the content covered in this course may not as technical and practical as other higher level ISOM courses. This course will provide you a wide range of IS concept and knowledge which are quite interesting and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think the lectures are not boring, but it depends whether you are interested in that IS topic or not. Tat Koon would ask which IS knowlegde or topic we want him to teach or cover at the beginning of the semester.
Btw, some of his jokes' quality are quite good actually.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is highly relied on the group project, as most people got pretty high marks in both midterm and final. But the grade is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: I think the workload is fair, no assignments or papers. Exams are not difficult. You just have to make sure that you understand all the IS comcept taught in the lectures.

reviews.author: uster
reviews.comment_content: His teaching is kind of not as useful as predicted, mainly regarding marketing instead of the technical IT knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: The way he teaches maybe unsuitable for those who want to learn concrete knowledge since he spends around 45 minutes each lesson for open discussion. Students will first discuss within themselves for 20 minutes and express themselves in coming 25 minutes. He praises each opinion.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good only if you answer his questions as many as you can so he can recognize you. The final exam is exactly the same with the question in the ppt notes.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is relatively small comparing with other professors, probably his standard is lower and he encourages participation.

reviews.author: ZRYhahahaha
reviews.title: Not much to learn
reviews.comment_content: useful knowledge presented in a rather unvivid way. However, you have to recite all the notes before final exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is fine, but sometimes hard to follow if you do not pay attention
reviews.comment_grading: A/A+ of 25%, but hard to get good grade if you do not pay attention throughout the semester. The final exams contains a lot of MCs and a bit of completion. The MCs are hard.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fairly light, with only one final exam and one group presentation. No group project, no homework.

reviews.author: Justin Lai
reviews.comment_content: Very detailed, updated course materials about the current development of information systems, including cloud computing, Big  Data, IoT...etc A good introduction to the current application of IT if you are not aware of it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Helpful, nice professor.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading, I got an A for this course. Exam is not really difficult, pay attention to the powerpoints used by the professor. Have presentations at the end of the course, but it is relatively easy to get good grades if you work really hard.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 final exam, 1 presentation, no homework, no mid-terms.

reviews.author: Yepyep
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content:
Not much. Just attend class because she gives short quizzes every lecture. But no worries, she always allows a chance for students to recover from mistakes.

Oh, there is one major group assignment. Good members = fun and happy working and grading. Bad members = hell. It's like every other group work. Good luck.

reviews.author: Tommy=]
reviews.comment_content:
主要係教有咩it system會係business world apply到,同埋現時it既一d大趨勢
但佢對attendance好嚴,基本你miss左佢上3次attendance就即刻fail (btw我好似miss左3堂但都未fail我)
reviews.comment_teaching: 本身個人講書幾funny,d野唔難明,臨考前背曬個堆notes就考得
reviews.comment_grading: 正路
reviews.comment_workload: 真心唔多,其實上足堂就唔怕miss左attendance,淨係得1個project同1個final,輕鬆搞掂

reviews.author: rita99
reviews.comment_content: This course is about basic information system, which is not very complicated but we seldom pay attention to.  Although it is a bit abstract, it can be mainly dealt with memorization, except 2-3 topics with calculation.
reviews.comment_teaching: She would tell you lots of examples to show how do demonstrate theories and principles.  She would be willing to answer your questions but sometimes  could not clarify clearly to make you understand.  There would be sudden quizzes in classes which are actually for taking attendance (just my view cuz she didn't care about what you have answered, you would just receive mark if you have done it )  Participation is needed in classes as well.  But it was quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading: The mark she gave was quite high, so the mean was also high, but it didn't mean the grade was very well.  I would say it was fair, the mean grading is around B or B-.  The final exam is emphasized. It would greatly affect your grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair, 1 mid term, 1 final, 1 group project (including a proposal, 1 presentation and 1 paper).  Industrial talks are included in participation mark.

reviews.author: chuang
reviews.comment_content: The content was interesting and not overly technical. The professor included everything on the slides. The lecture is filmed so if you missed a class, you can just watch it on canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very good. He spoke very clearly, and explained the concepts in a manner that was easy to understand. During the lecture before a quiz, he would highlight all the keypoints and information that may appear on the quiz. He also had a good sense of humour, so that made the lessons more fun.
reviews.comment_grading: The quizzes and projects were not difficult, so the mean was quite high for the quizzes. Participation also contributes to the grade. But he was considerate towards students who might be shy, and offered an alternative method of gaining participation points. Students can email the TA 5 links to articles or videos that are related to the course content. Overall the grading was quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was adequate. The quizzes were not difficult to study for, as long as you attend lectures, and pay attention when he talks about the quiz, as he gives a lot of hints. The group project was more time-consuming but not too difficult once the group comes up with a creative idea.

reviews.author: justastudent
reviews.title: Very good grade course
reviews.comment_content: Very easy content if you pay high attention in class. Things are very basic and no technical skills are required. Just recite everything in the note and you will get extremely good result.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr.P encourages people to think and discuss. So there are lots of gp discussion session every class.
reviews.comment_grading:
I participate actively in class so i guess my parti score is very high (you will never know your parti score but it counted for 10%)
Project is around 15% (you will not know the score too)
Mid term and Final both counted for 30%

I get one sd high than mean and participate all the classes, finally get A+
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely light, just revise all the teaching material one to two days before exam will be fine.

reviews.author: Gracia
reviews.comment_content:

Digital Economy
E-commerce

Database
WWW/Internet
Network Technology
reviews.comment_teaching:
She hands out lecture notes for every session,provides examples on explained concept.
Some basic calculation for several topic.
There are 5 lectures for presentation slot.You only need to attend 2/3 out of 5.

Short answer quizzes in 3 random lecture.

Non-cumulative final exam.

reviews.author: makmakmakmak
reviews.title: If he recognised you, congratulations you are hving gd grade, otherwise swap away
reviews.comment_content: lecture powerpoint are easy, just a few pages. And it's so different compare to other IS prof. Btw after taking his class you might consider not to take IS as a major. The content covered is useless but at least it would be easier for mid terms and exams
reviews.comment_teaching: You will hear your classmates talk more than he does coz most of the time he ask people to discuss then ask them to share. This usually make up half the class time. And when you find his ppt hard to understand and go back to watch lecture video, you will find that you have wasted an hour listening to him but getting nth useful written down because during his lecture he will either skip the slides or simply say the sentence on the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
Wooho~ Since i dun even know my project and final marks, i concluded that he give grades base on if he remembers you. Even if u sit there for every class, but not actively participating, you are still gonna get bad grades. So If you are planning to be a quiet student, SWAP AWAY!!
Good luck if you got him and couldn't swap away. Just put your hands up all the time, doesn't matter even if you answer sh_t, becoz he dones't care as long as he remembers you.
reviews.comment_workload:
Low
Just project and exams
The exams are just memory games, as long as you memorise everything on the ppt, you will know how to do.  Even if you not doing super well in exams, as long as you can catch his attention and make him recognise your face, you have gained yourself a god grade.

reviews.author: jesley
reviews.comment_content: half of the content you should have learned in the secondary school
reviews.comment_teaching:
the english was sometimes not clear but still can understand if you pay attention to the lesson

Basically common sense.

reviews.author: nltnip
reviews.comment_content: Content is not really difficult. It include a wide variety of basic knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Use different examples to explain IS ideas.
reviews.comment_grading: IS is so-called one of major with the best grade. Many students got A and B range. For me, midterm and final above for around one sd, group project is below average, A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Two out-of-class assignment, which required us to read the same passage at the beginning and the end of the semeter. Most of the workload, excluding midterm and final, would be the project, which requires us to create a new idea of IS and describe it using IS knowledge.

reviews.author: sunshine
reviews.comment_content: The syllabus is very well-designed in the sense that the topics are grouped into three to four themes, which makes it super easy to understand the logic flow within each of them. Regarding the materials, there is no required textbook but handouts, so no need to worry about buying expensive books for a good grade. Everyone is supposed to be on the same page in the beginning.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very passionate in teaching students. He always moves in front of the whiteboard to allow students in different corners of the classroom to speak up, making the lectures as interactive as possible.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam
Final exam
Group presentation
Group paper
Group peer evaluation (as grade adjustment indicator)
Class participation
reviews.comment_workload: I think in general this course's workload is rather light. Students need not prepare too much (except your brain) for every lecture. No (pop-up/scheduled) quizzes. However, when the time comes (i.e. as the deadline for group presentation is approaching), students usually feel quite stressed out. Frequent meetings and rehearsals are needed. One suggestion is to start brainstorming and consolidating the group ideas as early as possible.

reviews.author: jeffreycyh
reviews.comment_content: Quite interesting especially for people with no understanding about the topics covered in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture: Just some simple non-technical concepts, spoon-fed. But I appreciate that Tat Koon was trying to make the teaching better.

Lab: More on technical aspect, like VBA. Terribly spoon-fed, totally unrelated to the course itself, go for attendance only.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exam: For the True or False questions, some of them are pretty ambiguous and nonsense.
For the open-ended questions, your answers need to be following Tat Koon's marking scheme, TAs do not care about other reasonable answers.

Peer Evaluation: When everyone getting similar mid-term and final exam score, your grade turn out depends on the 'peer evaluation' and the 'peer evaluation on your peer evaluation'. Extremely ridiculous in my opinion.

Your grade probably will not align with your actual performance in the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
An easy introductory course, easier than many common core courses.

Project: Need to finish a report and a presentation with a large group, the workload is highly distributed among group members.

Exam: Not much to memorize

reviews.author: V.lylit
reviews.comment_content:
You will learn about what makes services such as social media websites and platforms (like this one) work - along with a lot of theories, real-life examples, and most importantly - future trends. (because otherwise you really could have read the book called Information Rules. It's a good book entailing some basic principles behind technological development and etc. You'll hear him recommending it as well)

There are also 10 lab sessions. Highly recommended not just for attendance score, but also some are quite useful, esp the pivot table.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Understandably this course has to be taught by passionate and friendly instructors, because it has to be used to lure people into the major (oops).  

TK is very insistent on encouraging participation in class, so please raise your hand to answer/ ask questions.  There are also some discussions in class based on what you've just learnt and some info that he was showing (usually real-life cases).  Of course, you do not want to use these opportunities to bs because you can train your critical thinking <-- something he values a lot (just saying)

Timture teaches the lab sessions.  He's VERY friendly and very willing to answer your questions.  If you follow his instructions you can breeze through it with no problem.  Also, if you don't like hearing Cantonese accent in English, either deal with it or register in another session.
reviews.comment_grading:
I consistently get slightly below mean scores in my midterm and final exam - I know I'm very bad at taking exams.  At least that did not stop me from getting an A- with the project score being quite good and participation being (top 15% of class - according to TK's email).

Now does that make you want to work hard for good grades and recognition? I hear these things boost self-esteem a lot :D
reviews.comment_workload:
Typically the workload is light: it has a midterm, final exam, one reading material (but he gave 2 questionnaires/ "assignments" for that), and a project (presentation + report).  The reading material was around 4 pages long, but I heard that some people wrote that they'd like to have more reading materials so I'm not sure if the load would become heavier next time it comes...

The workload could become heavy if your project groupmates 1. freeride, 2. don't agree with each other, or 3. somehow cannot understand what's happening with the idea that you (or another person) proposed - exactly what happened to my group...

reviews.author: enmity_long
reviews.comment_content: 內容簡單，貼近生活例子。主要係講下Digital Economy, E-commerce, Social Media, Business Intelligence, Big Data etc. 好technical既野佢好少講，主要係想同學明白IS同CS的分別，著重於如何配合Business world，而唔係創造新technology。
reviews.comment_teaching:
好有熱誠去教，歡迎同學問暇題或發表自己的意見。
過多幾堂佢就會記得大部分成日上堂同學既名，會主動同你打招呼同係上堂前傾下閒計。

教書用好多生活例子輔助，簡單易明。
reviews.comment_grading: 非常好。不用太擔心Project會影響好多，因為TK好注重peer evaluation，即使個製成品唔係好突出，但係你得到同組組員欣賞，比好高評價你，你既project分數絕唔會低。當然你比人插，自然會大幅拉低。
reviews.comment_workload: 最大workload莫過於要做一個Project。佢要求唔唔係好高，但身邊所有人總係好似電腦奇才咁，整哂啲曉飛既網頁，App interface 出黎。所以如果只係做到岩岩好，就會好容易比下去。

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching: CYZ is such a disappointing professor. Trust me, if you're pre-enrolled into her session, swap IMMEDIATELY!!! She doesn't have a good organisation of course contents and her lecture slides lack logic. And her English is sooooooooooooo bad that I can't even bear listening to her. It's such a pain to listen to her speaking. And she speaks soooooooo slow that I would say her English is everything but fluent. Also she corrects herself over and over again so it's hard to really get her rationale. And her tone is also quite hypnotising. It seems no matter how hard you try you simply can't focus on the class.

reviews.author: Lucy Han
reviews.comment_content: nformation systems (IS) is about managing the applications of IT to create business values. Topics include fundamental concepts of IS, e-commerce, digital and the internet economy, web 2.0 and social networks, online advertising, personalization and privacy, digital rights management and piracy, business intelligence, and decision-making, how organizations harness IS for innovative business strategies and the socio-economic impact of IS on organizations and societies. The labs cover business problem-solving skills.

reviews.comment_teaching: Basically he just read the slides, but he gave many daily examples and ask students to brainstorm which allowed students to understand the topics better.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got B+ at last.
Participation: 15/15
Labs: 12.65/15
Group Project: 20/20
Mid term exam: 19.75/25
Final Exam: 20.25/25

Participation: just leave some comments during lessons

Labs: attend labs and do the quizzes every time (unlimited attempt, so you can try the answers until you got all correct) + study for lab exam

Group Project: find better teammates, if you want to get better grade in this course

Exam: just study slides. Midterm exam consists of MCs and short q. Those short q is basically simple math. Final exam are short q only. And those short q is really typing and very little calculation.

I would say quite fair, but as more and more people want to get into IS, so this become more competitive. The differences between grades are narrow and small.

reviews.author: Chill Guy
reviews.comment_content: Standard
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tat Koon is a great professor, definitely (you could tell from his sense of rumour).

He is the kind of professor who would try to remember every student's name and be friendly with them throughout the semester. I bet most students enjoyed his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation15% (Industry Week talk 5%+ comments for other groups' project presentation 10%)
Labs15%
GroupProject20%
Midterm Exam20%
Final Exam30%

Study Guides as following:
For EXAMS:
- the course does not really cover a lot of contents, so exams would typically not be lengthy. So be extra Cautious to every detail in exam (make sure you mastered the limited lecture materials beforehand), since each wrong answer would lead to great deduction in marks.

For PROJECT:
- Typically every group would perform averagely well, so as the final score. But do remember to apply ISOM concepts in your project report and presentation (as well have a good relationship and bonding with your teammates! Peer evaluation is included in the grade review)

For LAB:
- For better and more efficient understanding of the lab session, do the pre-reading of class material before each class. Actually the content was not that difficult, everyone ended up with decent marks in the LAB final exam.

I ended up with an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Not so heavy.

Workload on courses is okay, but the team project require a lot of things. Peer evaluation plays and important role in grading(perhaps). So it is suggested that you be very very kind to your partners, even they are free-riding, since they can still give you bad comments.
Also, try to connect as many isom concepts in your reports no matter what he said. And it is common that students repeat his words in presentations.

reviews.author: mnm
reviews.title: ISOM 2010
reviews.comment_content:
In virtually every industry and every firm, information technology (IT) is driving change, creating opportunities and challenges. Leaders who don’t understand the fundamentals of information systems (IS) will be at a strategic disadvantage. IS have moved beyond the automation of back office functions, into the foreground of business strategy. IS play critical roles in competitive positioning and business process design.
This course provides broad coverage of technology concepts and trends underlying current and future developments in IT, and fundamental principles for the effective use of computer-based IS in businesses and other organizations. There will be a special emphasis on the digital economy, e- commerce, and business analytics. Other topics include: hardware/software, networking, the Internet, database, security, and enterprise applications. In additional to the fundamental conceptual and propositions in the IS area, a number of business applications, cases, and the newest trend in today’s technology domain will be discussed.

Topics:
Digital Economy
E-Commerce
Online Platforms
Business Analytics
Big Data Analytics
Emerging Technology

+ISOM2010 Lab
reviews.comment_teaching: Her voice is too soft and doesn't seem confident in what she's saying. She oftentimes mumbles and it's honestly really hard to understand her. She seems nice and kind but she is not good at explaining stuff-- but she tries. Her slides aren't very good and terminologies & explanations are not clearly displayed on the slides.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is ok– the mid-term is fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
Attendance for lab sessions- there are quizzes every once a week after the lab and there's a time constraint. You have unlimited trials.
Group project- you need to submit a proposal, ppt, do a presentation and submit another planning.
If you have the worst teammates, you basically doomed. Presentations are of very high quality; the contents are pretty much similar but the presentation slides and layouts are of extremely high quality and sophistication.

reviews.author: JasonY
reviews.comment_content:
Digital Economy
1. Explain data, information, and information systems.
2. Know the meaning of Moore’s law, Metcalf’s law and their implications.
3. Understand the implications of globalization.
4. Discuss the use of information systems in organizations.
5. Describe the newer aspects of working in the digital world.
6. Define ethics and describe the major ethical problems posed by the digital world.
Ecommerce
1. Describe the nature of e-business.
2. Define the e-business value chain and disintermediation.
3. Describe the basic e-business models.
4. Examine the major online marketing methods.
5. Discuss the major issues that are created by and affect e-business.
Social Media
1. Describe the key component of social media.
2. Explain the 3 features of social media authoring.
3. Understand the meaning of Tagging.
4. Explain the differences between traditional and social media.
Technical Foundations
1. Identify the major components of hardware and networking technology.
2. Identify the different types of software.
3. Describe the process in software development.
4. Discuss the trends in hardware and software, and the implications to businesses.
ISOM 2010, Hong Xu
3
Big Data
1. Explain how organizations use data and information.
2. Explain the basic concepts of data management (data creation, sharing, mining, reporting).
3. Define database management systems (DBMS) and describe their various functions.
4. Data storage within and across organizations.
5. Explain how the relational database model works.
6. Describe how databases are developed.
7. Explain how organizations can use data warehousing and data mining for decision making.
8. Describe advanced database models and when their use is appropriate.
Business Analytics and Decision Makings
1. Discuss the problems associated with management decision-making.
2. Explain the specific information needs of managers in different functional areas of an organization,
including production, operations, marketing and sales, accounting, human resources and IT.
3. Explain the decision-making process.
4. Explain the increasing roles and responsibilities of accountants as user and owner of data and the
corporate information system.
5. Describe decision support systems.
6. Describe the opportunities and threats to corporate information system including capabilities in data
treatment and analysis, data integrity, system security and issues in access restriction, and business
contingency/continuity.
7. Discuss the roles and trend of IT in business analytics and decision making
Business, Accounting and Finance
1. Formulate appropriate information systems strategies to support implementation of business and
functional strategies.
2. Use the system development life cycle to plan, design, implement, and evaluate an IT system.
3. Describe the application of information technology to accounting systems and the generation, reporting,
internal control and attestation of accounting information.
4. Recognize and understand the roles of accountants in all stages of the system development life cycle:
systems analysis; systems design; systems implementation; and systems operation and maintenance.
5. Demonstrate an understanding of the behavioral issues of implementing information systems in
organizations.
6. Describe how change management can contribute to successful implementation of information systems.
Technology-Enabled Business Trends
1. Identify major tech-enabled trends in near future
2. Examine impact of tech-enabled trends on individuals, firms, and society
3. Discuss business opportunities of new technologies
reviews.comment_teaching: she tried so hard to carry out the teaching materials with business and real-life examples but i don't know if its because of the syllabus of the course, I found it boring to me . But still, she is a good professor after all.
reviews.comment_grading:
relatively good grading compare with other instructors as I know,
no exact marks for project, presentation and finals.
mid term:
41/50, mean= 43/50
final unknown
project unknown but its bad I guess, more like average or below average
Result:B+ and got my major in IS
reviews.comment_workload: very light, no assignment only project and proposal

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Xu has a very flat tone. Sometimes it is pretty boring and will make you want to sleep. She basically reads from her powerpoint. Some of the important details are missing from the powerpoint and you have to pay attention to her class. Usually those important details will appear again in the exam.

But in general, her teaching is very clear. Since the content is not hard to understand. A lot of students will skip her class. However, she sometimes takes attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
In-Class Exercises 5%
Labs 15%
Research Project 20%
Midterm Exam 20%
Final Exam 30%

Grading is very good. Mean for mid-term is over 85% (since it is so easy). For project and final exam, grades are unknown. But I think as long as you work hard, your grades wont be too bad.

For the grade project, you should have some innovative ideas and do enough research on your topic. She asks harsh questions for the grade presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of stuff to do. Just that lab requires attendance. The grade project takes time to think of an innovative idea.

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.title: Apart from the lab, I thought I was taking a common core course...
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture:
1. Digital Economy
2. E-commerce
3. Social Media
4. Business Analytics and Big Data
Lab:
1. Web Analytics
2. Database using Microsoft Access
3. Business Analytics using Microsoft Excel
4. Advanced Business Analytics (some Excel VBA is included but you don't need prior knowledge of that, just follow the manual is enough)
5. Big Data Analytics (will learn Microsoft Azure)

For lecture content, all are straightforward stuff and just memorizing all the slides is already sufficient to handle the exams. The Business Analytics module requires a little bit of calculation but it is very easy to handle. For lab content, I find it very useful in my future career. Btw (4) and (5) will be included in the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Straightforward teaching with clear and concise explanations. Although it might be a bit boring I think it's acceptable. She is very willing to answer students' questions both during and after lectures as well, and she gives very detailed feedbacks in our projects. She also provides review lectures before the midterm and final. Overall a professor who teaches with heart.

The lab instructor goes through the manual step-by-step in a moderate speed, so it's not hard to follow. However, she speaks in a monotone and it's quite easy to fall asleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
In-Class Exercises 5%
Labs 15%
Research Project 20%
Midterm Exam 20%
Final Exam 30%

For participation, not many students answer or raise questions in class so I think most of us will get very similar marks.
For labs, attendance is required and there is a quiz at the end of each lab. Unlimited attempts are allowed so you should get full marks for them.
For the project, please refer to the workload part.
Both midterm and final consist of MCs and short questions. Final is non-cumulative but will include contents of Advanced Business Analytics and Big Data Analytics from the lab.
reviews.comment_workload: For both midterm and final, not much time is needed for revision so they are definitely manageable. The major workload comes from the project in which we need to analyze an e-commerce company, identify some of its issues and provide solutions, or propose a business model on a new technology. If you want to perform well in the project (including the proposal, presentation and final report), the workload will not be small.

reviews.author: sd
reviews.comment_content:
The content was very interesting and pretty easy.
The professor tried to input all the topics suggested by the students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was helpful.
Usually replied to emails well in time.
Made all the instructions very clear.
Tried to motivate all the students to do their best.
Provided good examples in class (especially in the slides)
All his lectures are recorded and can be found on canvas.
The professor was very witty and tried to engage all his students most of the time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was quite fair.
Even though some people expected a better grade, it was okay.
Don't have very high expectations, especially because you don't get to know the grade of the presentation and report.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is extremely light.
Only one assignment in the starting of the term.
Small quizzes in class.
Presentations are quite interesting but time taking
There is also a report to be submitted at the end of the term.

The midterm and final exam is quite easy, depending on how much you study. Watching the videos on canvas is a big help.

Tutorial is not very interesting, but it's compulsory to go to.

reviews.author: stolceins
reviews.title: A new professor
reviews.comment_content:
--MIDTERM--
L1 Overview
L2 Digital Economy (fundamentals of IT)
L3 Digital Economy 2 (Strategies of IT)
L4 Digital Economy 3 (Network effects and IT impact)
L5-6 E-Commerce

--FINAL--
L7 E-Commerce 3 (Cyber Security)
L9 Online Platforms
L10 FinTech 1
L11 FinTech 2 (Bitcoin)
L12 Social Media Management
L13+14 Social Media Management 2
L15 Google Case (not on the syllabus)
L16 Crowdsourcing
L17 Databases and Business Analytics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ms.Chan is a good professor although her English pronunciation is not very accurate with soft volume sometimes.
She could explain concepts and important terms with details and various examples (the examples were useful to understand the concepts and answer questions in the exam). She would ask questions and tried to engage students in the lectures. The PPTs were detailed and well-organised which were really easy to follow.
She asked students to write a card with name, photo, three surprising things about themselves at the beginning of the term.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation: 20%
4% > attending 2 talks in the Industrial Week
16% > commenting other groups' presentation
Labs: 15%
Application Development Project: 22% (financial deliverables+memo+report+presentation)
Midterm Exam: 18% (most MCs and 2 long questions)
Final Exam: 25% (50%mcs + 50%long questions)
reviews.comment_workload:
Generally not heavy. No assignments and only one project.
The workload of the ADP is quite light as the ADP consists of 3 main parts with different deadlines. Need to allocate time and work with group mates which are formed by students themselves. It is not required for all the group members to do the presentation.
The two exams were not difficult. Some MCs were similar to the examples taught in the lecture so it is important to attend the lecture (video lecture might be available afterwards). The long questions required students to explain the concepts learnt from the PPTs and they were not difficult to answer. (no need to write long answers). There would be a short news which is the big topic and students need to explain concepts regarding the passage.

reviews.comment_content: The content is not useful at all. You can never learn anything useful. Unfortunately, this is a required course for many students. This course totally wasted my time.  The tutorial is a bit better but still not very useful. So I will give a D here.

reviews.author: jenny-lee
reviews.title: A good intro class
reviews.comment_content: The content is a pretty high-level summary of general IT trends and topics. The most specifics you get into in this course would be beginner SQL. The rest are general explanations of social media network effect and in particular, the reasoning behind each concept.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor does a thorough job talking through the concepts and explaining them in-depth, even if the concepts are general and seem easy to understand. He is fair in his expectations and speaks at an understandable pace, especially through Zoom.
reviews.comment_grading: Extremely fair grading. There is of course the HKUST curve that is particularly difficult in this class, considering how many people are taking this intro-level course. However, the grade consists of a midterm, the final, and a group project that we worked quite hard for, but he ended up using as a grade booster for everyone (majority of people earned 95/100 and above on this project).
reviews.comment_workload: There is no workload except exam revision. Put in however much you want to, and you'll get out however much in return. Quite standard.

reviews.author: Sophia.m
reviews.title: Nice grading
reviews.comment_content: It gives you a very brief idea about IT and how does it work in businesses nowadays.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring in reality. Actually you need not attend the lesson at all as the professor just reads the lecture slides aloud. Also, he provided the mid term and final review ppt slides, if you can remember everything in those two slides, you can get an A easily.
reviews.comment_grading: I guess fair enough.You just need to recite things carefully and do the lab things again before the exam. I got around 1.5 sd in mid term while the project and the final is unknown. I got A+ finally. I got the best presentation award too. I guess the grading is quite nice if you work hard.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not great. You only need to hand in a group project and do a presentation( u can choose to deliver with your whole group or do it individually) and a brief document about your proposal. There are two talks to attend. If you cannot attend, you can choose to write the reflection.

reviews.author: Muriqui
reviews.title: Best Prof. in the first year
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture:
-Digital Economy
-E-commerce
-Software/Hardware
-Database&Analytics
-Online platforms
-Social Media
-Big Data
-Crowdsourcing
Lab:
-Big Data Analysis

At the first look, I think that the conclusions are obvious. But when I carefully comprehend his explanations, I can find the logic chain among the contents.

reviews.author: Jinnie

The PPTs are brief and incoherent, you would have no idea what they were talking about in class if you don't attend lectures. But every time I do attend lectures I'd doze off for sure.

reviews.comment_grading: Class grade consists of participation, group project, midterm, final and lab. Everyone can get full participation marks and professor gives good marks to all projects so difference between groups is really small. Final is really important because total points are fewer on the final paper and the gap would be enlarged between people once converted to a 100 scale. Half sd above mean in midterm, one sd in final and almost full mark in lab final, got A+ for final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload would be a little bit heavy if you care a lot about the group project. If not, this is a course with almost zero workload(except for exam period) with no homework and no attendance taking.

reviews.author: ihategpprojects
reviews.title: Rubbish Dr P
reviews.comment_content:
Very simple and basic contents, like e-commerce, digital world, softwares, hardwares, Google and privacy policy of Facebook.
Simple stuff, care barely learn anything.
Probably it is the course problem, because all professors are teaching similar contents as it is an introduction course. But I dont think this introduction course can help any student to make a decision of whether to major in IS or not.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is nice and talk about many things not related to IS. Always give u 10 minutes to discuss with your friends and use another 15 minutes to do the discussion.
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor.
My mark is above mean in midterm.
Final and project marks are still unknown. But I have spent a lot of time doing the project as there are many freeriders.
At last, I only get a B.
Maybe the professor not recognise me, so he gave me a B because he thought I am not active enough in his class. But seriously, participation counts only 10-20% meanwhile the project counts 25-30% and exams count 60%.
reviews.comment_workload:
Low workload, only the project takes time.
Midterm and final need to write 4 essays/ long questions.

reviews.author: nonamefinger
reviews.comment_content: Content too basic and easy...honestly not much useful...but good to know some technologies in modern world...labs give you some taste of different computer things
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite relaxing, most of time is watching videos, just need to answer question to get participation points

labs are so easy but have to arrive on time because they take attendance with computers
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is soso, not good and not bad. Above mean for more than half sd for both quizzes, final exam and result and project score not released, B+.....Most classmates I know got B+
reviews.comment_workload: Almost no workload for this course, only two very easy quizzes, one very very easy final exam (10% only), one project and participation. Even though you don't answer question in class to get points, you can send the professor links of interesting videos to get participation points. But, since the quizzes and exams are all very ease, the mean is very high and it is difficult to over-perform your classmates, and easy to under-performance if you made any careless mistakes

reviews.author: chickenhkust
reviews.title: Major Foundation Course for IS (extremely important for those who want to declare IS as their first or second major)
reviews.comment_content: Please refer to others for the content. For Spring 2021, professor waived some contents in the Final, which was really helpful for me to delve into other concepts taught throughout the semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: First of all, I get the feeling of perfection whenever I attend his class. Moreover, his voice is really nice. He really encourages students to share their idea.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is really lenient, considering that this is a major foundation course. I don't want to release the detailed grade for every single assessment. What I can tell you is that since the concepts taught aren't that difficult, try to secure the top score. I got an A in the end. Tbh, I might be slightly biased since I got a satisfactory letter grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There are numerous thing you should do including the lab session. However, those are really helpful and I hope the course structure remains unchanged for the upcoming semesters. The workload is not that high and is absolutely manageable. No worries!

reviews.author: belowme
reviews.comment_content:
Same as others, basic python stuff:

Syllabus
Introduction to Syllabus
Introduction to Python
Python Basics 1
Python Basics 2
String
List, Tuple, and Set
Conditional Flow Statements
Loops Statements
